00048 /*===========================================================================
00049  *
00050  *      File :          r_regalloc.c
00051  *      Description :   Register allocation interface functions 
00052  *      Creation Date : July 12, 1991
00053  *      Author :        Richard Hank
00054  *
00055  * Revision 4.0  95/01/10  17:33:26  17:33:26  hank (Richard E. Hank)
00056  * Region-based Allocation:  This version incorporates the preliminary work
00057  *   on region based compilation into the register allocation process.
00058  *   
00059  *   1)  Region-based allocation is done if the parameter 
00060  *       "region_based_allocation" is set.
00061  *   2)  Function-based allocation is done if the function contains
00062  *       no region markers or the above flag is not set.
00063  * 
00064  * Implementation changes:
00065  *   1) The virtual register array has finally been eliminated and replaced
00066  *      by a somewhat more dynamic linked list.
00067  *   2) The register allocator no longer returns a structure since the
00068  *      registers used in each bank are returned through pointers passed to
00069  *      it via R_define_physical_bank
00070  *   3) All spill code related functions have been moved to r_regspill.c
00071  * 
00072  * Revision 3.0  94/03/16  20:58:17  20:58:17  hank (Richard E. Hank)
00073  * Several Changes:
00074  * 1) A destination virtual register of an instruction may now be allocated  
00075  *    to the same register as a source virtual register  - exactly how this
00076  *    will interact with pruning is not yet determined.
00077  * 2) The register bank description functions have been moved to r_regbank.c.
00078  *    Changes to the register bank description are described there.
00079  * 3) Spilled live ranges are now split at the cb and instruction level
00080  *    in extreme register pressure situations.  (i.e. x86)
00081  *    The code has been moved to a separate file.
00082  * 4) Several PA-RISC specific and MCB hacks are present.
00083  * 
00084  * Revision 2.0  93/06/14  21:55:17  21:55:17  hank (Richard E. Hank)
00085  * "This version contains the following major revisions:
00086  *   1) Eliminated the need for explicit spill registers.  Spill register
00087  *      bank definitions are allowed, but they are ignored.
00088  *   2) The interference graph is pruned to remove unconstrained virtual
00089  *      registers prior to coloring
00090  *   3) The actual allocation algorithm repeats the coloring process until
00091  *      all virtual registers have been assigned a registers, this was
00092  *      necessitated by the elimination of explicit spill registers.
00093  *      -> Results in a much improved allocation
00094  *   4) Spill code insertion has been further optimized by eliminating
00095  *      unecessary spill stores whenever possible."
00096  * 
00097  * Revision 1.1  93/04/19  12:56:56  12:56:56  hank (Richard E. Hank)
00098  * Initial revision
00099  * 
00100  *      Copyright (c) 1991,1992,1993,1994  
00101  *                         Richard Hank, Wen-mei Hwu and The Board of
00102  *                         Trustees of the University of Illinois. 
00103  *                         All rights reserved.
00104  *      The University of Illinois software License Agreement
00105  *      specifies the terms and conditions for redistribution.
00106  *===========================================================================*/
00107

00155 /* -Fminimize_spill_fill=(yes|no)
00156  * If 0, R_insert_jsr_spill_fill_code() spills and fills every live register
00157  * around each jsr.  If 1, we try to do things more intelligently.  If
00158  * a register is live across two jsrs, but is not used between the jsrs
00159  * (and neither jsr is predicated and there is no branch between jsrs), we
00160  * eliminiate the useless fill and spill of the register between the jsrs.
00161  *
00162  * spill r1;           spill r1;
00163  * spill r2;           spill r2;
00164  * jsr foo1            jsr foo1;
00165  * fill r1;            fill r1;
00166  * fill r2;      =>    r3 = r1++;
00167  * r3 = r1++;          spill r1
00168  * spill r1;           jsr foo2;
00169  * spill r2;           fill r1;
00170  * jsr foo2;           fill r2;
00171  * fill r1;
00172  * fill r2;
00173  *
00174  * This is a big win in straight line code with lots of jsrs, such as you
00175  * see when compiling C++. */
00176 int R_Minimize_Spill_Fill = 0;
00177

00242 /*===========================================================================
00243  *
00244  *      Func :  R_read_parm_regalloc()    
00245  *      Desc :  Reads option file and loads register allocation parameters 
00246  *              Sets the following globals:
00247  *                  R_Register_Allocation = 1/0  (1=default)
00248  *                  R_Macro_Allocation = 1/0     (1=default)
00249  *                  R_Constant_Preloading = 1/0  (0=default)
00250  *                  R_Loop_Removal = 1/0         (0=default)
00251  *                  R_Live_Range_Splitting = 1/0 (0=default)
00252  *      Input:  Parm_Parse_Info *ppi; 
00253  *      Output: none
00254  *
00255  *      Side Effects: as described above 
00256  *
00257  *===========================================================================*/
00258 static void
00259 R_read_parm_regalloc (Parm_Parse_Info * ppi)
00260 {
00261   L_read_parm_b (ppi, "spill_everything", &R_Spill_Everything);
00262   L_read_parm_b (ppi, "region_based_allocation", &R_Region_Based_Allocation);
00263   L_read_parm_b (ppi, "prune_interference_graph",
00264                  &R_Prune_Interference_Graph);
00265   L_read_parm_b (ppi, "?round_robin_allocation", &R_Round_Robin_Allocation);
00266   L_read_parm_b (ppi, "schedule_invariant_allocation",
00267                  &R_Schedule_Invariant_Alloc);
00268   L_read_parm_b (ppi, "macro_allocation", &R_Macro_Allocation);
00269   L_read_parm_b (ppi, "utilize_profile_info", &R_Utilize_Profile_Info);
00270   L_read_parm_b (ppi, "prevent_MCB_preload_spills",
00271                  &R_Prevent_MCB_Preload_Spills);
00272   L_read_parm_b (ppi, "same_cycle_anti_dep_interference",
00273                  &R_Same_Cycle_Anti_Deps_Interference);
00274   L_read_parm_b (ppi, "print_macroregisters", &R_Print_Macroregisters);
00275   L_read_parm_b (ppi, "print_live_ranges", &R_Print_Live_Ranges);
00276   L_read_parm_b (ppi, "print_interference_graph",
00277                  &R_Print_Interference_Graph);
00278   L_read_parm_b (ppi, "print_class_selection", &R_Print_Class_Selection);
00279   L_read_parm_b (ppi, "print_allocation", &R_Print_Allocation);
00280   L_read_parm_b (ppi, "print_coloring_stats", &R_Print_Coloring_Stats);
00281   L_read_parm_b (ppi, "print_allocation_stats", &R_Print_Allocation_Stats);
00282   L_read_parm_b (ppi, "print_parm_configuration",
00283                  &R_Print_Parm_Configuration);
00284   L_read_parm_b (ppi, "print_bank_configuration",
00285                  &R_Print_Bank_Configuration);
00286   L_read_parm_b (ppi, "print_dead_code_results", &R_Print_Dead_Code_Results);
00287 
00288   L_read_parm_b (ppi, "print_virtual_register_function",
00289                  &R_Print_Virtual_Register_Function);
00290   L_read_parm_b (ppi, "allow_dead_code_elimination",
00291                  &R_Allow_Dead_Code_Elimination);
00292   L_read_parm_b (ppi, "minimize_spill_fill", &R_Minimize_Spill_Fill);
00293 
00294   if (R_Spill_Everything)
00295     R_Register_Allocation = 0;
00296 
00297   if (R_Spill_Everything || !R_Register_Allocation)
00298     R_Macro_Allocation = 0;
00299 
00300   if (R_Schedule_Invariant_Alloc)
00301     R_Invariant_Vreg_Priorities = 1;
00302 
00303   if (M_arch == M_X86 && !R_Macro_Allocation)
00304     {
00305       L_warn ("RA (x86): Macro Allocation defaulted to 'yes'\n");
00306       R_Macro_Allocation = 1;
00307     }
00308 
00309   return;
00310 }

00314 void
00315 R_print_parm_configuration (void)
00316 {
00317   fprintf (stdout, "*\n*\n* Register Allocator Configuration\n*\n*\n");
00318 
00319   fprintf (stdout, "spill_everything:          %s\n",
00320            ON_OFF (R_Spill_Everything));
00321   fprintf (stdout, "macro_allocation:          %s\n",
00322            ON_OFF (R_Macro_Allocation));
00323   fprintf (stdout, "utilize_profile_info:      %s\n",
00324            ON_OFF (R_Utilize_Profile_Info));
00325   fprintf (stdout, "region_based_allocation:   %s\n",
00326            ON_OFF (R_Region_Based_Allocation));
00327   fprintf (stdout, "prune_interference_graph:  %s\n",
00328            ON_OFF (R_Prune_Interference_Graph));
00329   fprintf (stdout, "\n");
00330   fprintf (stdout, "print_parm_configuration:  %s\n",
00331            ON_OFF (R_Print_Parm_Configuration));
00332   fprintf (stdout, "print_bank_configuration:  %s\n",
00333            ON_OFF (R_Print_Bank_Configuration));
00334   fprintf (stdout, "print_live_ranges:         %s\n",
00335            ON_OFF (R_Print_Live_Ranges));
00336   fprintf (stdout, "print_class_selection:     %s\n",
00337            ON_OFF (R_Print_Class_Selection));
00338   fprintf (stdout, "print_coloring_stats:      %s\n",
00339            ON_OFF (R_Print_Coloring_Stats));
00340   fprintf (stdout, "print_allocation:          %s\n",
00341            ON_OFF (R_Print_Allocation));
00342   fprintf (stdout, "print_allocation_stats:    %s\n",
00343            ON_OFF (R_Print_Allocation));
00344 
00345   fprintf (stdout, "\n\n");
00346 
00347   return;
00348 }

00350 
00351 static R_Reg *
00352 R_new_reg (int vreg_id, int type, double weight, int def, int rclass)
00353 {
00354   R_Reg *new_vreg;
00355 
00356   new_vreg = (R_Reg *) L_alloc (R_alloc_virtual_register);
00357   new_vreg->flags = R_CURRENT_VREG;
00358   new_vreg->nextReg = R_vreg;
00359   R_vreg = new_vreg;
00360 
00361   HashTable_insert (R_vregHashTbl, vreg_id, new_vreg);
00362   R_n_vreg += 1;
00363 
00364   new_vreg->ref_weight = weight;
00365   new_vreg->def_weight = def ? weight : 0;
00366   
00367   new_vreg->rclass = rclass;
00368   new_vreg->type = type;
00369   new_vreg->size = 0;
00370   new_vreg->index = vreg_id;
00371   new_vreg->base_index = -1;
00372   new_vreg->spill_loc = -1;
00373   new_vreg->ref_instr = NULL;
00374   new_vreg->live_range = NULL;
00375   new_vreg->def_instr = NULL;
00376   new_vreg->ref_cbs = NULL;
00377   new_vreg->pvreg = NULL;
00378   new_vreg->instr_weight = 0;
00379   new_vreg->priority = 0.0;
00380   new_vreg->interfere = NULL;
00381   new_vreg->illegal_reg = NULL;
00382   new_vreg->constraints = NULL;
00383   new_vreg->rotating = 0;
00384   new_vreg->nth_rot_reg = -1;
00385   new_vreg->caller_benefit = 0;
00386   new_vreg->callee_benefit = 0;
00387   
00388   new_vreg->intf_vreg = NULL;
00389 
00390   return new_vreg;
00391 }
00392 
00393 /*===========================================================================
00394  *
00395  *      Func :  R_add_register()  
00396  *      Desc :  Defines a new virtual register 
00397  *      Input:  int vreg_id     - virtual register number
00398  *              int type        - virtual register type
00399  *              double weight   - instruction execution frequency
00400  *      Output: none
00401  *
00402  *      Side Effects:  allocation of new R_Reg structure 
00403  *
00404  *===========================================================================*/
00405 R_Reg *
00406 R_add_register (int vreg_id, int type, double weight, int def)
00407 {
00408   R_Reg *new_vreg;
00409 
00410   if ((new_vreg = VREG (vreg_id)))
00411     {
00412       /* Found existing vreg -- check for type match and update weights */
00413 
00414       if (new_vreg->type != R_Ltype_to_Rtype (type))
00415         {
00416           /* Special case for Playdoh here - SAM 11-97 */
00417           if ((M_model == M_HP_PLAYDOH_MCODE)
00418               && ((new_vreg->type == R_FLOAT)
00419                   || (new_vreg->type == R_DOUBLE)))
00420             new_vreg->type = R_DOUBLE;
00421           else
00422             L_punt ("R_add_register: Virtual register type conflict\n"
00423                     "\t vreg %d occurs first with type %s\n"
00424                     "\t and subsequently with type %s.\n",
00425                     new_vreg->index, BANK_NAME (new_vreg->type),
00426                     BANK_NAME (R_Ltype_to_Rtype (type)));
00427         }
00428 
00429       new_vreg->ref_weight += weight;
00430       if (def)
00431         new_vreg->def_weight += weight;    
00432     }
00433   else
00434     {  
00435       /* Create a new vreg */      
00436 
00437       switch (type)
00438         {
00439         case L_CTYPE_PREDICATE:
00440           type = R_PREDICATE;
00441           break;
00442         case L_CTYPE_INT:
00443         case L_CTYPE_LLONG:
00444           type = R_INT;
00445           break;
00446         case L_CTYPE_FLOAT:
00447           type = R_FLOAT;
00448           break;
00449         case L_CTYPE_DOUBLE:
00450           type = R_DOUBLE;
00451           break;
00452         case L_CTYPE_BTR:
00453           type = R_BTR;
00454           break;
00455         case L_CTYPE_POINTER:
00456           type = R_POINTER;
00457           break;
00458         default:
00459           L_punt ("RA: invalid virtual register type: %d", type);
00460           break;
00461         }
00462 
00463       new_vreg = R_new_reg (vreg_id, type, weight, def, R_PREFER_SPILL);
00464     }
00465 
00466   return (new_vreg);
00467 }
00468 
00469 /*===========================================================================
00470  *
00471  *      Func :  R_find_free_vreg()   
00472  *      Desc :  Returns a new virtual register number 
00473  *      Input:  none 
00474  *      Output: int
00475  *
00476  *      Side Effects: increments L_fn->max_reg_id
00477  *
00478  *===========================================================================*/
00479 int
00480 R_find_free_vreg (void)
00481 {
00482   int new_vreg = ++(L_fn->max_reg_id);
00483 
00484   if (new_vreg == 0)
00485     new_vreg = ++(L_fn->max_reg_id);
00486 
00487   return (new_vreg);
00488 }
00489 
00490 /*===========================================================================
00491  *
00492  *      Func :  R_spill_loc()   
00493  *      Desc :  Returns a new swap space offset 
00494  *      Input:  none 
00495  *      Output: int
00496  *
00497  *      Side Effects: none
00498  *
00499  *===========================================================================*/
00500 int
00501 R_spill_loc (int type)
00502 {
00503   int loc = -1;
00504 
00505   if (M_arch != M_TAHOE)
00506     {
00507       switch (type)
00508         {
00509         case R_PREDICATE:
00510         case R_INT:
00511         case R_FLOAT:
00512         case R_BTR:
00513         case R_POINTER:
00514           loc = int_spill_stack;
00515           int_spill_stack += 4;
00516           fp_spill_stack = int_spill_stack;
00517           break;
00518         case R_DOUBLE:
00519           /* ensure double boundary in register swap space */
00520           if ((int_spill_stack % 8) != 0)
00521             int_spill_stack += (8 - (int_spill_stack % 8));
00522           loc = int_spill_stack;
00523           int_spill_stack += 8;
00524           fp_spill_stack = int_spill_stack;
00525           break;
00526         default:
00527           L_punt ("RA (R_spill_loc): invalid virtual register type: %d", type);
00528         }
00529     }
00530   else
00531     {
00532       switch (type)
00533         {
00534         case R_INT:
00535         case R_BTR:
00536           loc = int_spill_stack;
00537           int_spill_stack += 8;
00538           break;
00539         case R_FLOAT:
00540         case R_DOUBLE:
00541           /* ensure 16 byte boundary in register swap space */
00542           if ((fp_spill_stack % 16) != 0)
00543             fp_spill_stack += (16 - (fp_spill_stack % 16));
00544           loc = fp_spill_stack;
00545           fp_spill_stack += 16;
00546           break;
00547         case R_PREDICATE:
00548           /* L_punt ("Unable to spill predicate register.\n"); */
00549           /* EMN */
00550           loc = pred_spill_stack;
00551           pred_spill_stack += 1;
00552           break; 
00553         default:
00554           L_punt ("RA (R_spill_loc): invalid virtual register type: %d", type);
00555         }
00556     }
00557   return (loc);
00558 }
00559 
00560 /*===========================================================================
00561  *
00562  *      Func :  R_add_macro_register  
00563  *      Desc :  Defines the virtual register for a macro register available
00564  *              to the register allocator. The virtual register is treated
00565  *              as if it has already been allocated to this macro.
00566  *      Input:  int vreg_id     - macro virtual register id
00567  *              int mac         - macro register
00568  *              int type        - macro register type
00569  *              int rclass      - macro register bank (CALLER/CALLEE)    
00570  *      Output: none
00571  *
00572  *      Side Effects: allocation of new R_Reg structure
00573  *
00574  *===========================================================================*/
00575 R_Reg *
00576 R_add_macro_register (int vreg_id, int mac, int type, int rclass)
00577 {
00578   R_Physical_Bank *bank;
00579   R_Reg *new_vreg;
00580   int i, *map, found = 0;
00581   int size = 0, base_index = 0;
00582 
00583   new_vreg = VREG (vreg_id);
00584   if (new_vreg)
00585     return (new_vreg);
00586 
00587   /* locate the macro register in the appropriate bank that this */
00588   /* virtual register has already been "allocated" to            */
00589 
00590   if ((rclass != R_MACRO_CALLER) &&
00591       (rclass != R_MACRO_CALLEE))
00592     L_punt ("RA: Unidentified rclass");
00593 
00594   bank = R_bank + type + rclass;
00595   if (bank->defined)
00596     {
00597       map = R_map[type + rclass];
00598       for (i = 0; i < bank->num_reg; i++)
00599         {
00600           if (mac == map[i * bank->reg_size])
00601             {
00602               size = bank->reg_size;
00603               base_index =
00604                 bank->base_index + i * bank->reg_size;
00605               found = 1;
00606               
00607               R_pa_set = Set_add (R_pa_set, base_index);
00608 
00609               break;
00610             }
00611         }
00612     }
00613 
00614   if (!found)
00615     L_punt ("RA: invalid macro %d (%s)", mac, L_macro_name (mac));
00616 
00617   new_vreg = R_new_reg (vreg_id, type, 0.0, 0, rclass);
00618 
00619   new_vreg->flags |= R_PREALLOCATED_MACRO;
00620 
00621   new_vreg->size = size;
00622   new_vreg->base_index = base_index;
00623 
00624   new_vreg->caller_benefit = -1;
00625   new_vreg->callee_benefit = -1;
00626 
00627   return (new_vreg);
00628 }
00629 
00630 /*===========================================================================
00631  *
00632  *      Func :  R_determine_available_macros()   
00633  *      Desc :  Scans for R_MACRO_CALLER and R_MACRO_CALLEE register
00634  *              banks to determine what macro registers are available
00635  *              if any. 
00636  *      Input:  none 
00637  *      Output: none
00638  *
00639  *      Side Effects:   allocates and defines globals: <R_avail_macro_array>,
00640  *                      <R_avail_macro_vreg_id>,<R_jsr_def_macros>,
00641  *                      <R_jsr_def_vreg_id>,<R_n_avail_macro>, and
00642  *                      <R_n_jsr_def_macro>
00643  *
00644  *===========================================================================*/
00645 
00646 void
00647 R_determine_available_macros (void)
00648 {
00649   int i, j, type, vreg_id;
00650   int *map, n_macro, mac_reg;
00651   R_Physical_Bank *bank;
00652 
00653   R_n_avail_macro = 0;
00654   R_n_jsr_def_macro = 0;
00655 
00656   if (!R_Macro_Allocation)
00657     return;
00658 
00659   n_macro = 0;
00660   /* determine a ceiling on the number of available macro registers */
00661   /* for memory allocation purposes                                 */
00662   for (i = 0; i < R_NUM_TYPES; i++)
00663     {
00664       type = i * R_TYPE_INC;
00665       bank = R_bank + type + R_MACRO_CALLER;
00666       if (bank->defined)
00667         n_macro += bank->num_reg * bank->reg_size;
00668       bank = R_bank + type + R_MACRO_CALLEE;
00669       if (bank->defined)
00670         n_macro += bank->num_reg * bank->reg_size;
00671     }
00672   if (n_macro == 0)
00673     return;
00674 
00675   R_avail_macro = (R_Macro *) malloc (sizeof (R_Macro) * n_macro);
00676   R_jsr_def_macro = (R_Macro *) malloc (sizeof (R_Macro) * n_macro);
00677 
00678   for (i = 0; i < R_NUM_TYPES; i++)
00679     {
00680       type = i * R_TYPE_INC;
00681       bank = R_bank + type + R_MACRO_CALLER;
00682       if (bank->defined)
00683         {
00684           map = R_map[type + R_MACRO_CALLER];
00685           for (j = 0; j < bank->num_reg; j++)
00686             {
00687               mac_reg = map[j * bank->reg_size];
00688 
00689               vreg_id = R_find_free_vreg ();
00690               R_avail_macro[R_n_avail_macro].id = mac_reg;
00691               R_avail_macro[R_n_avail_macro].type = type;
00692               R_avail_macro[R_n_avail_macro++].vreg_id = vreg_id;
00693 
00694               /* define macros defined by a jsr */
00695               R_jsr_def_macro[R_n_jsr_def_macro].id = mac_reg;
00696               R_jsr_def_macro[R_n_jsr_def_macro].type = type;
00697               R_jsr_def_macro[R_n_jsr_def_macro++].vreg_id = vreg_id;
00698 
00699               R_add_macro_register (vreg_id, mac_reg, type, R_MACRO_CALLER);
00700             }
00701         }
00702       bank = R_bank + type + R_MACRO_CALLEE;
00703       if (bank->defined)
00704         {
00705           map = R_map[type + R_MACRO_CALLEE];
00706           for (j = 0; j < bank->num_reg; j++)
00707             {
00708               mac_reg = map[j * bank->reg_size];
00709 
00710               vreg_id = R_find_free_vreg ();
00711               R_avail_macro[R_n_avail_macro].id = mac_reg;
00712               R_avail_macro[R_n_avail_macro].type = type;
00713               R_avail_macro[R_n_avail_macro++].vreg_id = vreg_id;
00714 
00715               R_add_macro_register (vreg_id, mac_reg, type, R_MACRO_CALLEE);
00716             }
00717         }
00718     }
00719   if (R_Print_Macroregisters)
00720     {
00721       fprintf (stdout, "Available Macroregisters:\n");
00722       for (i = 0; i < R_n_avail_macro; i++)
00723         fprintf (stdout, "\t(mac %s %s) assigned virtual register %d\n",
00724                  L_macro_name (R_avail_macro[i].id),
00725                  L_ctype_name (R_conv_type_to_Ltype (R_avail_macro[i].type)),
00726                  R_avail_macro[i].vreg_id);
00727       fprintf (stdout, "JSR Defined Macroregisters:\n");
00728       for (i = 0; i < R_n_jsr_def_macro; i++)
00729         fprintf (stdout, "\t(mac %s %s) assigned virtual register %d\n",
00730                  L_macro_name (R_avail_macro[i].id),
00731                  L_ctype_name (R_conv_type_to_Ltype (R_avail_macro[i].type)),
00732                  R_avail_macro[i].vreg_id);
00733     }
00734   return;
00735 }
00736 
00737 Set
00738 R_process_illegal_register_attr (L_Attr * attr)
00739 {
00740   int i, j, found;
00741   L_Operand *preg;
00742   int type, *map, size;
00743   R_Physical_Bank *bank;
00744   Set constraints = NULL;
00745   R_Reg *vreg_ptr = VREG (attr->field[0]->value.r);
00746 
00747   if (vreg_ptr == NULL)
00748     {
00749       fprintf (stderr, "Illegal operand in ill_reg attribute:");
00750       L_print_operand (stdout, attr->field[0], 0);
00751       L_punt ("R_process_illegal_register_attr: Illegal operand.");
00752     }
00753 
00754   for (i = 1; i < attr->max_field; i++)
00755     {
00756       preg = attr->field[i];
00757       type = R_Ltype_to_Rtype (L_return_old_ctype (preg));
00758 
00759       found = 0;
00760       if (L_is_register (preg))
00761         {
00762           bank = R_bank + type + R_CALLER;
00763           if (bank->defined)
00764             {
00765               map = R_map[type + R_CALLER];
00766               size = bank->reg_size;
00767               for (j = 0; j < bank->num_reg; j++)
00768                 {
00769                   if (map[j * size] == preg->value.r)
00770                     {
00771                       constraints = Set_add (constraints,
00772                                              bank->base_index +
00773                                              j * bank->reg_size);
00774                       found = 1;
00775                       break;
00776                     }
00777                 }
00778             }
00779           if (found)
00780             continue;
00781 
00782           bank = R_bank + type + R_CALLEE;
00783           if (bank->defined)
00784             {
00785               map = R_map[type + R_CALLEE];
00786               size = bank->reg_size;
00787               for (j = 0; j < bank->num_reg; j++)
00788                 {
00789                   if (map[j * size] == preg->value.r)
00790                     {
00791                       constraints = Set_add (constraints,
00792                                              bank->base_index +
00793                                              j * bank->reg_size);
00794                       found = 1;
00795                       break;
00796                     }
00797                 }
00798             }
00799           if (!found)
00800             L_punt ("Regalloc: unknown register in ill_reg attribute: %d!!\n",
00801                     preg->value.r);
00802         }
00803       else if (L_is_macro (preg))
00804         {
00805           bank = R_bank + type + R_MACRO_CALLER;
00806           if (bank->defined)
00807             {
00808               map = R_map[type + R_MACRO_CALLER];
00809               size = bank->reg_size;
00810               for (j = 0; j < bank->num_reg; j++)
00811                 {
00812                   if (map[j * size] == preg->value.mac)
00813                     {
00814                       constraints = Set_add (constraints,
00815                                              bank->base_index +
00816                                              j * bank->reg_size);
00817                       found = 1;
00818                       break;
00819                     }
00820                 }
00821             }
00822           if (found)
00823             continue;
00824 
00825           bank = R_bank + type + R_MACRO_CALLEE;
00826           if (bank->defined)
00827             {
00828               map = R_map[type + R_MACRO_CALLEE];
00829               size = bank->reg_size;
00830               for (j = 0; j < bank->num_reg; j++)
00831                 {
00832                   if (map[j * size] == preg->value.mac)
00833                     {
00834                       constraints = Set_add (constraints,
00835                                              bank->base_index +
00836                                              j * bank->reg_size);
00837                       found = 1;
00838                       break;
00839                     }
00840                 }
00841             }
00842           if (!found)
00843             L_punt ("Regalloc: unknown macro in ill_reg attribute: %d!!\n",
00844                     preg->value.mac);
00845         }
00846       else
00847         L_punt ("Regalloc: illegal operand type in ill_reg attribute!!\n");
00848     }
00849   vreg_ptr->illegal_reg = Set_union (vreg_ptr->illegal_reg, constraints);
00850   Set_dispose (constraints);
00851   return (NULL);
00852 }
00853 
00854 /* Use isl attribute instead of old scheduler structures to get
00855  * operation issue time. -JCG 6/99
00856  */
00857 int
00858 R_issue_time (L_Oper * oper)
00859 {
00860   L_Attr *attr;
00861 
00862   /* Handle case where prepass scheduling is not done */
00863   if ((attr = L_find_attr (oper->attr, "isl")) ||
00864       (attr = L_find_attr (oper->attr, "cycle")))
00865     {
00866       /* Sanity check, make sure first field is an int */
00867       if ((attr->field[0] == NULL) || !L_is_int_constant (attr->field[0]))
00868         L_punt ("R_issue_time: isl field[0] not an int!");
00869 
00870       return (attr->field[0]->value.i);
00871     }
00872 
00873   return (-1);
00874 }
00875 
00876 /* Build a set with all of the registers that require rotation for 
00877  * this function.
00878  * Use the following functions to access:   
00879  * Set_dispose(R_rot_reg);
00880  * Set_in(R_rot_reg, reg_id) 
00881  */
00882 Set
00883 R_build_rotating_reg_set (L_Func * fn)
00884 {
00885   Set R_rot_reg = NULL;
00886   int int_rot_reg_base;
00887   int int_rot_reg_num;
00888   int flt_rot_reg_base;
00889   int flt_rot_reg_num;
00890   int dbl_rot_reg_base;
00891   int dbl_rot_reg_num;
00892   int pred_rot_reg_base;
00893   int pred_rot_reg_num;
00894   int i;
00895 
00896   R_get_rot_regs (fn, &int_rot_reg_base, &int_rot_reg_num,
00897                   &flt_rot_reg_base, &flt_rot_reg_num,
00898                   &dbl_rot_reg_base, &dbl_rot_reg_num,
00899                   &pred_rot_reg_base, &pred_rot_reg_num);
00900 
00901   if (int_rot_reg_num == 0 &&
00902       flt_rot_reg_num == 0 && dbl_rot_reg_num == 0 && pred_rot_reg_num == 0)
00903     {
00904       return NULL;
00905     }
00906 
00907   for (i = int_rot_reg_base; i < (int_rot_reg_base + int_rot_reg_num); i++)
00908     R_rot_reg = Set_add (R_rot_reg, i);
00909 
00910   for (i = flt_rot_reg_base; i < (flt_rot_reg_base + flt_rot_reg_num); i++)
00911     R_rot_reg = Set_add (R_rot_reg, i);
00912 
00913   for (i = dbl_rot_reg_base; i < (dbl_rot_reg_base + dbl_rot_reg_num); i++)
00914     R_rot_reg = Set_add (R_rot_reg, i);
00915 
00916   for (i = pred_rot_reg_base; i < (pred_rot_reg_base + pred_rot_reg_num); i++)
00917     R_rot_reg = Set_add (R_rot_reg, i);
00918 
00919   return R_rot_reg;
00920 }
00921 
00922 void
00923 R_get_rot_regs (L_Func * fn, int *int_base, int *int_num,
00924                 int *flt_base, int *flt_num,
00925                 int *dbl_base, int *dbl_num, int *pred_base, int *pred_num)
00926 {
00927   L_Attr *rr_attr = NULL;
00928 
00929   /* Check for erroneous pointer to the function */
00930   if (fn == NULL)
00931     L_punt ("R_get_rotating_reg_set: NULL function input.");
00932 
00933   /* Find the attribute that contains the rotating register numbers. */
00934   rr_attr = L_find_attr (fn->attr, "rr");
00935 
00936   /* Obtain the ranges of the rotating registers, or return the empty
00937      set of there are none for this function. */
00938   if (rr_attr != NULL)
00939     {
00940       *int_base = rr_attr->field[0]->value.i;
00941       *int_num = rr_attr->field[1]->value.i;
00942       *flt_base = rr_attr->field[2]->value.i;
00943       *flt_num = rr_attr->field[3]->value.i;
00944       *dbl_base = rr_attr->field[4]->value.i;
00945       *dbl_num = rr_attr->field[5]->value.i;
00946       *pred_base = rr_attr->field[6]->value.i;
00947       *pred_num = rr_attr->field[7]->value.i;
00948     }
00949   else
00950     {
00951       int start_reg = (((++fn->max_reg_id) + 100) / 100) * 100;
00952       
00953       *int_base = start_reg;
00954       if (M_arch == M_TAHOE)
00955         *flt_base = *int_base + 96;
00956       else
00957         *flt_base = *int_base +
00958           R_get_rot_reg_max_alloc (M_native_int_register_ctype());
00959 #if 0
00960       *dbl_base = *flt_base +
00961         R_get_rot_reg_max_alloc (L_CTYPE_FLOAT);
00962 #else
00963       *dbl_base = *flt_base + 0;
00964 #endif
00965 
00966       *pred_base = *dbl_base +
00967         R_get_rot_reg_max_alloc (L_CTYPE_DOUBLE);
00968       fn->max_reg_id = *pred_base +
00969         R_get_rot_reg_max_alloc (L_CTYPE_PREDICATE);
00970 
00971       *int_num = 0;
00972       *flt_num = 0;
00973       *dbl_num = 0;
00974       *pred_num = 0;
00975 
00976       rr_attr = L_new_attr ("rr", 8);
00977       L_set_int_attr_field (rr_attr, 0, *int_base);
00978       L_set_int_attr_field (rr_attr, 1, 0);
00979       L_set_int_attr_field (rr_attr, 2, *flt_base);
00980       if (M_arch != M_TAHOE)
00981         L_set_int_attr_field (rr_attr, 3, 0);
00982       else
00983 #if 0
00984         L_set_int_attr_field (rr_attr, 3, 
00985                               R_get_rot_reg_max_alloc (L_CTYPE_FLOAT));      
00986 #else
00987         L_set_int_attr_field (rr_attr, 3, 0);
00988 #endif
00989       L_set_int_attr_field (rr_attr, 4, *dbl_base);
00990       if (M_arch != M_TAHOE)
00991         L_set_int_attr_field (rr_attr, 5, 0);
00992       else
00993         L_set_int_attr_field (rr_attr, 5, 
00994                               R_get_rot_reg_max_alloc (L_CTYPE_DOUBLE));
00995       L_set_int_attr_field (rr_attr, 6, *pred_base);
00996       if (M_arch != M_TAHOE)
00997         L_set_int_attr_field (rr_attr, 7, 0);
00998       else
00999         L_set_int_attr_field (rr_attr, 7, 
01000                               R_get_rot_reg_max_alloc (L_CTYPE_PREDICATE));
01001       fn->attr = L_concat_attr (fn->attr, rr_attr);
01002     }
01003 
01004   return;
01005 }
01006 
01007 /*===========================================================================
01008  *
01009  *      Func :  R_process_cb()   
01010  *      Desc :  Defines an R_Instr structure for every instruction within
01011  *              the control block to be used for dataflow analysis. 
01012  *              The operands of each instruction are examined for virtual
01013  *              registers or macros contained in <R_avail_macro_array>  
01014  *      Input:  L_Func *fn      - current function
01015  *              L_Cb *cb        - current control block 
01016  *      Output: none
01017  *
01018  *      Side Effects: allocates and defines an R_Instr structure for 
01019  *                    each instruction  
01020  *
01021  *===========================================================================*/
01022 
01023 #define R_MATCHING_MACRO(l_opd, r_mac) (((l_opd)->value.mac == (r_mac).id) && \
01024     (R_Ltype_to_Rtype (L_return_old_ctype ((l_opd))) == (r_mac).type))
01025 
01026 
01027 void
01028 R_process_cb (L_Cb * cb)
01029 {
01030   L_Oper *oper;
01031   L_Operand *opd;
01032   int i, j, this_cycle = -1, new_cycle;
01033   int *buffer = R_buf;
01034   L_Attr *attr;
01035   Set cb_vregs = NULL, cb_oper_set = NULL, defined_this_cycle = NULL;
01036 
01037   int hyperblock = 
01038     L_EXTRACT_BIT_VAL (L_fn->flags, L_FUNC_CC_IN_PREDICATE_REGS) | 
01039     L_EXTRACT_BIT_VAL (cb->flags, L_CB_HYPERBLOCK);
01040   
01041   /* if local_conflict, all live ranges def'd/used in a given CB conflict. */
01042   int local_conflict = R_Schedule_Invariant_Alloc;
01043 
01044   /* if same_cycle_conflict, zero-cycle anti-dependences cause live ranges
01045    * to conflict. */
01046   int same_cycle_conflict = R_Same_Cycle_Anti_Deps_Interference &&
01047     (M_arch != M_X86);
01048 
01049   /* Scan each instruction in the cb, adding the use and def information
01050      to the set of live ranges. */
01051   for (oper = cb->first_op; oper; oper = oper->next_op)
01052     {
01053       int mac, vreg = 0;
01054       R_Reg *vreg_ptr = NULL;
01055 
01056       R_oper_set = Set_add (R_oper_set, oper->id);
01057 
01058       /* build a set of oper id's for cb */
01059       if (local_conflict)
01060         cb_oper_set = Set_add (cb_oper_set, oper->id);
01061 
01062       if (same_cycle_conflict && 
01063           ((new_cycle = R_issue_time (oper)) != -1) &&
01064           (new_cycle != this_cycle))
01065         {
01066           defined_this_cycle = Set_dispose (defined_this_cycle);
01067           this_cycle = new_cycle;
01068         }
01069 
01070       /* guard predicate */
01071 
01072       if ((opd = oper->pred[0]) && L_is_variable (opd))
01073         {
01074           if (L_is_reg (opd))
01075             {
01076               vreg = opd->value.r;
01077               vreg_ptr = R_add_register (vreg, L_return_old_ctype (opd), 
01078                                          oper->weight, 0);
01079             }
01080           else if (L_is_macro (opd))
01081             {
01082               mac = opd->value.mac;
01083               vreg = -1 - mac;
01084               
01085               for (j = 0; j < R_n_avail_macro; j++)
01086                 if (R_MATCHING_MACRO(opd, R_avail_macro[j]))
01087                   {
01088                     vreg = R_avail_macro[j].vreg_id;                    
01089                     vreg_ptr = VREG (vreg);
01090 
01091                     if (!(vreg_ptr->flags & R_CURRENT_VREG))
01092                       vreg_ptr->flags |= R_CURRENT_VREG;                
01093 
01094                     L_assign_type_general_register (opd);
01095                     opd->value.r = vreg;
01096 
01097                     break;
01098                   }
01099             }
01100 
01101           L_add_src_operand_reg (oper, vreg, FALSE, TRUE);
01102 
01103           if (vreg >= 0)
01104             {
01105               vreg_ptr->ref_instr = Set_add (vreg_ptr->ref_instr, oper->id);
01106 
01107               if (M_model == M_HP_PLAYDOH_MCODE)
01108                 vreg_ptr->ref_cbs = Set_add (vreg_ptr->ref_cbs, cb->id);
01109 
01110               if (local_conflict)
01111                 cb_vregs = Set_add (cb_vregs, vreg);
01112             }
01113         }
01114 
01115       /* src operands */
01116 
01117       for (i = 0; i < L_max_src_operand; i++)
01118         {
01119           if (!(opd = oper->src[i]))
01120             continue;
01121           if (L_is_reg (opd))
01122             {
01123               vreg = opd->value.r;
01124               vreg_ptr = R_add_register (vreg, L_return_old_ctype (opd), 
01125                                          oper->weight, 0);
01126             }
01127           else if (L_is_macro (opd))
01128             {
01129               mac = opd->value.mac;
01130               vreg = -1 - mac;
01131               for (j = 0; j < R_n_avail_macro; j++)
01132                 {
01133                   if (R_MATCHING_MACRO(opd, R_avail_macro[j]))
01134                     {
01135                       vreg = R_avail_macro[j].vreg_id;
01136                       vreg_ptr = VREG (vreg);
01137 
01138                       if (!(vreg_ptr->flags & R_CURRENT_VREG))
01139                         vreg_ptr->flags |= R_CURRENT_VREG;
01140 
01141                       L_assign_type_general_register (opd);
01142                       opd->value.r = vreg;
01143 
01144                       break;
01145                     }
01146                 }
01147             }
01148           else
01149             {
01150               continue;
01151             }
01152 
01153           L_add_src_operand_reg (oper, vreg, FALSE, FALSE);
01154 
01155           if (vreg >= 0)
01156             {
01157               vreg_ptr->ref_instr =
01158                 Set_add (vreg_ptr->ref_instr, oper->id);
01159 
01160               /* we need a general way to do this */
01161               if (M_arch == M_HPPA && oper->opc == Lop_MUL_F &&
01162                   L_find_attr (oper->attr, "reg_special"))
01163                 vreg_ptr->flags |= R_PA_HACK;
01164 
01165               if (M_model == M_HP_PLAYDOH_MCODE)
01166                 vreg_ptr->ref_cbs = Set_add (vreg_ptr->ref_cbs, cb->id);
01167 
01168               if (local_conflict)
01169                 cb_vregs = Set_add (cb_vregs, vreg);
01170             }
01171         }
01172 
01173       /* EMN: Extended source support */
01174 
01175       if ((oper->opc == Lop_CHECK) && (attr = L_find_attr (oper->attr, "src")))
01176         for (i = 0; i < attr->max_field; i++)
01177           {
01178             if (!(opd = attr->field[i]))
01179               continue;
01180 
01181             if (L_is_reg (opd))
01182               {
01183                 vreg = opd->value.r;
01184                 vreg_ptr = R_add_register (vreg, L_return_old_ctype (opd),
01185                                            oper->weight, 0);
01186               }
01187             else if (L_is_macro (opd))
01188               {
01189                 printf ("regalloc.c : here\n");
01190                 mac = opd->value.mac;
01191                 vreg = -1 - mac;
01192 
01193                 for (j = 0; j < R_n_avail_macro; j++)
01194                   if (R_MATCHING_MACRO(opd, R_avail_macro[j]))
01195                     {
01196                       vreg = R_avail_macro[j].vreg_id;
01197                       vreg_ptr = VREG (vreg);
01198                       
01199                       if (!(vreg_ptr->flags & R_CURRENT_VREG))
01200                         vreg_ptr->flags |= R_CURRENT_VREG;
01201 
01202                       L_assign_type_general_register (opd);
01203                       opd->value.r = vreg;
01204                       break;
01205                     }
01206               }
01207             else
01208               {
01209                 continue;
01210               }
01211 
01212             L_add_src_operand_reg (oper, vreg, FALSE, FALSE);
01213 
01214             if (vreg >= 0)
01215               {
01216                 vreg_ptr->ref_instr =
01217                   Set_add (vreg_ptr->ref_instr, oper->id);
01218 
01219                 /* we need a general way to do this */
01220                 if (M_arch == M_HPPA && oper->opc == Lop_MUL_F &&
01221                     L_find_attr (oper->attr, "reg_special"))
01222                   vreg_ptr->flags |= R_PA_HACK;
01223 
01224                 if (M_model == M_HP_PLAYDOH_MCODE)
01225                   vreg_ptr->ref_cbs = Set_add (vreg_ptr->ref_cbs, cb->id);
01226 
01227                 if (local_conflict)
01228                   cb_vregs = Set_add (cb_vregs, vreg);
01229               }
01230           }
01231 
01232       /* dest operands */
01233 
01234       for (i = 0; i < L_max_dest_operand; i++)
01235         {
01236           int trans = FALSE, uncond = FALSE;
01237                 
01238           if (!(opd = oper->dest[i]))
01239             continue;
01240 
01241           if (L_is_reg (opd))
01242             {
01243               vreg = opd->value.r;
01244               vreg_ptr = R_add_register (vreg, L_return_old_ctype (opd), 
01245                                          oper->weight, 1);
01246             }
01247           else if (L_is_macro (opd))
01248             {
01249               mac = opd->value.mac;
01250               vreg = -1 - mac;
01251 
01252               for (j = 0; j < R_n_avail_macro; j++)
01253                 if (R_MATCHING_MACRO(opd, R_avail_macro[j]))
01254                   {
01255                     vreg = R_avail_macro[j].vreg_id;
01256                     vreg_ptr = VREG (vreg);
01257 
01258                     if (!(vreg_ptr->flags & R_CURRENT_VREG))
01259                       vreg_ptr->flags |= R_CURRENT_VREG;
01260 
01261                     L_assign_type_general_register (opd);
01262                     opd->value.r = vreg;
01263                     break;
01264                   }
01265             }
01266           else
01267             {
01268               continue;
01269             }
01270 
01271           if (L_is_ctype_predicate (opd))
01272             {
01273               if (L_is_update_predicate_ptype (opd->ptype))
01274                 trans = TRUE;
01275               if (L_is_uncond_predicate_ptype (opd->ptype))
01276                 uncond = TRUE;
01277             }
01278 
01279           L_add_dest_operand_reg(oper, vreg, trans, uncond);
01280 
01281           if (vreg >= 0)
01282             {
01283               vreg_ptr->ref_instr = Set_add (vreg_ptr->ref_instr, oper->id);
01284               vreg_ptr->def_instr = Set_add (vreg_ptr->def_instr, oper->id);
01285 
01286               /*
01287                * The defining instruction must be in the live range
01288                * within a hyperblock
01289                */
01290               if (hyperblock)
01291                 {
01292                   vreg_ptr->live_range =
01293                     Set_add (VREG (vreg)->live_range, oper->id);
01294                 }
01295 
01296               /* SAM 3-97 - Remember referencing for all regs w/
01297                  playdoh emul */
01298               if (M_model == M_HP_PLAYDOH_MCODE)
01299                 vreg_ptr->ref_cbs = Set_add (vreg_ptr->ref_cbs, cb->id);
01300 
01301               /*
01302                * MCB Hack
01303                */
01304               if (R_Prevent_MCB_Preload_Spills &&
01305                   (L_find_attr (oper->attr, "MCB") != NULL) &&
01306                   op_flag_set (oper->proc_opc, OP_FLAG_LOAD))
01307                 vreg_ptr->flags |= R_MCB_PRELOAD;
01308 
01309               /*
01310                * PA Hack
01311                */
01312               if (M_arch == M_HPPA)
01313                 if (oper->opc == Lop_DIV_F2 || oper->opc == Lop_DIV_F ||
01314                     oper->opc == Lop_SQRT_F2 || oper->opc == Lop_SQRT_F)
01315                   vreg_ptr->live_range =
01316                     Set_add (vreg_ptr->live_range, oper->id);
01317 
01318               /*
01319                * CMOV Hack:
01320                * If the opcode is a cmov, add the destination operand
01321                * as a source for dataflow analysis.
01322                */
01323               if (L_cmov_opcode (oper))
01324                 L_add_src_operand_reg (oper, vreg, FALSE, FALSE);
01325 
01326               /*
01327                * Region Hack
01328                * -> The vreg defined by the last instruction in an exit cb
01329                *    of a region will have may have an empty LR, so as a quick
01330                *    fix add a last oper to the LR of the vreg, always.
01331                */
01332               if (R_Region_Based_Allocation)
01333                 vreg_ptr->live_range =
01334                   Set_add (vreg_ptr->live_range, oper->id);
01335 
01336               if (!oper->next_op)
01337                 vreg_ptr->live_range =
01338                   Set_add (vreg_ptr->live_range, oper->id);
01339 
01340               /*
01341                * Add previous instructions at the same issue time to the 
01342                * live range, subsquent instructions at the same issue time
01343                * will be placed in the live range automatically, unless
01344                * you can issue flow-dep instructions in the same cycle causing
01345                * the live range do be defined, used and dead in the same cycle
01346                */
01347 
01348               if (same_cycle_conflict && this_cycle != -1)
01349                 {
01350                   L_Oper *prev = oper;
01351 
01352                   vreg_ptr->intf_vreg = Set_union_acc (vreg_ptr->intf_vreg,
01353                                                        defined_this_cycle);
01354                   defined_this_cycle = Set_add (defined_this_cycle, vreg);
01355 
01356                   while ((prev = prev->prev_op) &&
01357                          (R_issue_time (prev) == this_cycle))
01358                     {
01359                       vreg_ptr->live_range =
01360                         Set_add (vreg_ptr->live_range, prev->id);
01361                     }
01362                 }
01363 
01364               if ((M_arch == M_HPPA) && 
01365                   (oper->opc == Lop_MUL_F) &&
01366                   L_find_attr (oper->attr, "reg_special"))
01367                 vreg_ptr->flags |= R_PA_HACK;
01368 
01369               if (local_conflict)
01370                 cb_vregs = Set_add (cb_vregs, vreg);
01371             }
01372         }
01373 
01374       if (op_flag_set (oper->proc_opc, OP_FLAG_JSR))
01375         R_jsr_list = List_insert_last (R_jsr_list, oper);
01376 
01377       if (oper->opc == Lop_CHECK)
01378         R_extend_set = Set_add (R_extend_set, oper->id);
01379 
01380       /*
01381        * Constraint Hack - added for x86 :)
01382        */
01383       attr = oper->attr;
01384       while ((attr = L_find_attr (attr, "ill_reg")) != NULL)
01385         {
01386           R_process_illegal_register_attr (attr);
01387           attr = attr->next_attr;
01388         }
01389 
01390       if (op_flag_set (oper->proc_opc, OP_FLAG_RTS))
01391         {
01392           R_rts = oper;
01393         }
01394     }
01395 
01396   if (defined_this_cycle)
01397     defined_this_cycle = Set_dispose (defined_this_cycle);
01398 
01399   /*
01400    * In effort make the allocation invariant to small scheduling
01401    * changes, the lifetime of a vreg is set to contain every operation
01402    * within a cb in which it is referenced.  It will also contain every
01403    * operation in a cb wherein it is live, this will be handled
01404    * during live range construction.
01405    */
01406 
01407   if (local_conflict)
01408     {
01409       int n_vreg = Set_2array (cb_vregs, buffer);
01410       for (i = 0; i < n_vreg; i++)
01411         {
01412           R_Reg *vreg = VREG (buffer[i]);
01413           vreg->intf_vreg = Set_union_acc (vreg->intf_vreg, cb_vregs);
01414 
01415           vreg->live_range = Set_union_acc (vreg->live_range, cb_oper_set);
01416         }
01417       Set_dispose (cb_vregs);
01418       Set_dispose (cb_oper_set);
01419     }
01420   return;
01421 }
01422 
01423 
01424 void
01425 R_process_cb_for_spilling (L_Func * fn, L_Cb * cb)
01426 {
01427   L_Oper *oper;
01428   L_Operand *opd;
01429 
01430   for (oper = cb->first_op; oper != NULL; oper = oper->next_op)
01431     {
01432       int i;
01433       R_Reg *vreg_ptr;
01434       L_Attr *attr;
01435 
01436       /* dest operands */
01437 
01438       for (i = 0; i < L_max_dest_operand; i++)
01439         if ((opd = oper->dest[i]) && L_is_reg (opd))
01440           vreg_ptr = R_add_register (opd->value.r, L_return_old_ctype (opd),
01441                                      oper->weight, 1);
01442 
01443       /* src operands */
01444 
01445       for (i = 0; i < L_max_src_operand; i++)
01446         if ((opd = oper->src[i]) && L_is_reg (opd))
01447           vreg_ptr = R_add_register (opd->value.r, L_return_old_ctype (opd),
01448                                      oper->weight, 0);
01449 
01450       /* guard predicate */
01451       
01452       if ((opd = oper->pred[0]) && L_is_reg (opd))
01453         vreg_ptr = R_add_register (opd->value.r, L_return_old_ctype (opd),
01454                                    oper->weight, 0);
01455 
01456       /* EMN: Extended source support */
01457 
01458       if ((attr = L_find_attr (oper->attr, "src")) && oper->opc == Lop_CHECK)
01459         for (i = 0; i < attr->max_field; i++)
01460           if ((opd = attr->field[i]) && L_is_reg (opd))
01461             vreg_ptr = R_add_register (opd->value.r, L_return_old_ctype (opd),
01462                                        oper->weight, 0);
01463     }
01464 
01465   return;
01466 }
01467 
01468 R_Reg *
01469 R_reset_vreg_list (R_Reg * vregList)
01470 {
01471   R_Reg *vreg, *next, *newList = NULL;
01472 
01473   for (vreg = vregList; vreg != NULL; vreg = next)
01474     {
01475       next = vreg->nextReg;
01476 
01477       if (vreg->flags & R_PREALLOCATED_MACRO)
01478         {
01479           vreg->nextReg = newList;
01480           newList = vreg;
01481         }
01482       else
01483         {
01484           vreg->flags = 0;
01485           vreg->size = 0;
01486           vreg->rclass = R_PREFER_SPILL;
01487           vreg->base_index = -1;
01488           vreg->nextReg = NULL;
01489           vreg->live_range = NULL;
01490           if (vreg->ref_instr != vreg->live_range)
01491             {
01492               Set_dispose (vreg->def_instr);
01493               Set_dispose (vreg->ref_cbs);
01494               Set_dispose (vreg->ref_instr);
01495               Set_dispose (vreg->live_range);
01496             }
01497           else
01498             {
01499               Set_dispose (vreg->live_range);
01500             }
01501         }
01502       vreg->spill_loc = -1;
01503 
01504       vreg->ref_instr = NULL;
01505       vreg->def_instr = NULL;
01506       vreg->ref_cbs = NULL;
01507       vreg->pvreg = NULL;
01508       vreg->ref_weight = 0.0;
01509       vreg->def_weight = 0.0;
01510       vreg->instr_weight = 0;
01511       vreg->priority = 0.0;
01512       vreg->interfere = NULL;
01513       vreg->rotating = 0;
01514       vreg->nth_rot_reg = -1;
01515       vreg->caller_benefit = -1;
01516       vreg->callee_benefit = -1;
01517     }
01518   return (newList);
01519 }
01520 
01521 /*===========================================================================
01522  *
01523  *      Func :  R_register_saving_convention_selection()
01524  *      Desc :  From the execution frequency of the function and the
01525  *              number of subroutine calls contained within a given
01526  *              live range, this function determines whether a caller or
01527  *              callee saved register is more beneficial.
01528  *      Input:  L_Func *fn      - current function
01529  *      Output: none
01530  *
01531  *      Side Effects: allocates and defines an R_Instr structure for 
01532  *                    each instruction  
01533  *
01534  *===========================================================================*/
01535 void
01536 R_register_saving_convention_selection (L_Func * fn, L_Region * region)
01537 {
01538   int i, j, leaf, index;
01539   double spill_weight;
01540   int *pref_alloc, *pref_alloc1, *pref_alloc2;
01541   int callee_allocated1 = 0;
01542   double caller_benefit, callee_benefit, *callee_benefit2 = NULL;
01543   double total_benefit1 = 0.0, total_benefit2 = 0.0;
01544   R_Reg *vreg;
01545   L_Oper *cur_jsr;
01546 
01547   double callee_cost[R_NUM_TYPES];
01548   double caller_cost[R_NUM_TYPES];
01549   double spill_load_cost[R_NUM_TYPES];
01550   double spill_store_cost[R_NUM_TYPES];
01551 
01552   if (R_Region_Based_Allocation)
01553     {
01554       if (L_find_attr (region->attr, "leaf") != NULL)
01555         leaf = 1;
01556       else
01557         leaf = 0;
01558     }
01559   else
01560     {
01561       leaf = (List_size (R_jsr_list) == 0);
01562     }
01563 
01564   /*
01565    * Initialize caller/callee/spill cost function data
01566    * from the code generator
01567    */
01568   caller_cost[0] = R_caller_cost (L_CTYPE_PREDICATE, leaf);
01569   caller_cost[1] = R_caller_cost (L_CTYPE_INT, leaf);
01570   caller_cost[2] = R_caller_cost (L_CTYPE_FLOAT, leaf);
01571   caller_cost[3] = R_caller_cost (L_CTYPE_DOUBLE, leaf);
01572   caller_cost[4] = R_caller_cost (L_CTYPE_BTR, leaf);
01573   caller_cost[5] = R_caller_cost (L_CTYPE_POINTER, leaf);
01574 
01575   callee_cost[0] = R_callee_cost (L_CTYPE_PREDICATE, leaf, 0);
01576   callee_cost[1] = R_callee_cost (L_CTYPE_INT, leaf, 0);
01577   callee_cost[2] = R_callee_cost (L_CTYPE_FLOAT, leaf, 0);
01578   callee_cost[3] = R_callee_cost (L_CTYPE_DOUBLE, leaf, 0);
01579   callee_cost[4] = R_callee_cost (L_CTYPE_BTR, leaf, 0);
01580   callee_cost[5] = R_callee_cost (L_CTYPE_POINTER, leaf, 0);
01581 
01582 #if 0
01583   sub_callee_cost[0] = R_callee_cost (L_CTYPE_PREDICATE, leaf, 1);
01584   sub_callee_cost[1] = R_callee_cost (L_CTYPE_INT, leaf, 1);
01585   sub_callee_cost[2] = R_callee_cost (L_CTYPE_FLOAT, leaf, 1);
01586   sub_callee_cost[3] = R_callee_cost (L_CTYPE_DOUBLE, leaf, 1);
01587 #endif
01588 
01589   spill_load_cost[0] = R_spill_load_cost (L_CTYPE_PREDICATE);
01590   spill_load_cost[1] = R_spill_load_cost (L_CTYPE_INT);
01591   spill_load_cost[2] = R_spill_load_cost (L_CTYPE_FLOAT);
01592   spill_load_cost[3] = R_spill_load_cost (L_CTYPE_DOUBLE);
01593   spill_load_cost[4] = R_spill_load_cost (L_CTYPE_BTR);
01594   spill_load_cost[5] = R_spill_load_cost (L_CTYPE_POINTER);
01595 
01596   spill_store_cost[0] = R_spill_store_cost (L_CTYPE_PREDICATE);
01597   spill_store_cost[1] = R_spill_store_cost (L_CTYPE_INT);
01598   spill_store_cost[2] = R_spill_store_cost (L_CTYPE_FLOAT);
01599   spill_store_cost[3] = R_spill_store_cost (L_CTYPE_DOUBLE);
01600   spill_store_cost[4] = R_spill_store_cost (L_CTYPE_BTR);
01601   spill_store_cost[5] = R_spill_store_cost (L_CTYPE_POINTER);
01602 
01603   if (R_Print_Class_Selection)
01604     {
01605       fprintf (stderr, "\n*** Register Bank Class Selection ***\n\n");
01606       fprintf (stderr, "(function weight+1) ----> %f\n", (fn->weight + 1.0));
01607       fprintf (stderr, "Store Cost:\n");
01608       fprintf (stderr, "\tPredicate --> %.5f\n", spill_store_cost[0]);
01609       fprintf (stderr, "\tInt       --> %.5f\n", spill_store_cost[1]);
01610       fprintf (stderr, "\tFloat     --> %.5f\n", spill_store_cost[2]);
01611       fprintf (stderr, "\tDouble    --> %.5f\n", spill_store_cost[3]);
01612       fprintf (stderr, "\tBtr       --> %.5f\n", spill_store_cost[4]);
01613       fprintf (stderr, "\tPointer   --> %.5f\n", spill_store_cost[5]);
01614       fprintf (stderr, "\nLoad Cost:\n");
01615       fprintf (stderr, "\tPredicate --> %.5f\n", spill_load_cost[0]);
01616       fprintf (stderr, "\tInt       --> %.5f\n", spill_load_cost[1]);
01617       fprintf (stderr, "\tFloat     --> %.5f\n", spill_load_cost[2]);
01618       fprintf (stderr, "\tDouble    --> %.5f\n", spill_load_cost[3]);
01619       fprintf (stderr, "\tBtr       --> %.5f\n", spill_load_cost[4]);
01620       fprintf (stderr, "\tPointer   --> %.5f\n", spill_load_cost[5]);
01621       fprintf (stderr, "\nCaller Cost:\n");
01622       fprintf (stderr, "\tPredicate --> %.5f\n", caller_cost[0]);
01623       fprintf (stderr, "\tInt       --> %.5f\n", caller_cost[1]);
01624       fprintf (stderr, "\tFloat     --> %.5f\n", caller_cost[2]);
01625       fprintf (stderr, "\tDouble    --> %.5f\n", caller_cost[3]);
01626       fprintf (stderr, "\tBtr       --> %.5f\n", caller_cost[4]);
01627       fprintf (stderr, "\tPointer   --> %.5f\n", caller_cost[5]);
01628       fprintf (stderr, "\nCallee Cost:\n");
01629       fprintf (stderr, "\tPredicate --> %.5f\n", callee_cost[0]);
01630       fprintf (stderr, "\tInt       --> %.5f\n", callee_cost[1]);
01631       fprintf (stderr, "\tFloat     --> %.5f\n", callee_cost[2]);
01632       fprintf (stderr, "\tDouble    --> %.5f\n", callee_cost[3]);
01633       fprintf (stderr, "\tBtr       --> %.5f\n", callee_cost[4]);
01634       fprintf (stderr, "\tPointer   --> %.5f\n", callee_cost[5]);
01635 #if 0
01636       fprintf (stderr, "\nSubsequent Callee Cost:\n");
01637       fprintf (stderr, "\tPredicate --> %.5f\n", sub_callee_cost[0]);
01638       fprintf (stderr, "\tInt       --> %.5f\n", sub_callee_cost[1]);
01639       fprintf (stderr, "\tFloat     --> %.5f\n", sub_callee_cost[2]);
01640       fprintf (stderr, "\tDouble    --> %.5f\n", sub_callee_cost[3]);
01641 #endif
01642       fprintf (stderr, "\nSubroutine Calls:\n");
01643 
01644       List_start (R_jsr_list);
01645       while ((cur_jsr = (L_Oper *)List_next (R_jsr_list)))
01646         fprintf (stderr, "\t%d\n", cur_jsr->id);
01647     }
01648 
01649   pref_alloc1 = (int *) malloc (sizeof (int) * (fn->max_reg_id + 1));
01650   pref_alloc2 = (int *) malloc (sizeof (int) * (fn->max_reg_id + 1));
01651 
01652   i = 0;
01653   total_benefit1 = 0.0;
01654   total_benefit2 = 0.0;
01655 
01656   for (vreg = R_vreg; vreg != NULL; vreg = vreg->nextReg)
01657     {
01658       double jsr_cost = 0.0;
01659       double ref_weight = -1.0;
01660 
01661       if (vreg->flags & R_PREALLOCATED_MACRO)
01662         continue;
01663 
01664       List_start (R_jsr_list);
01665       while ((cur_jsr = (L_Oper *)List_next (R_jsr_list)))
01666         {
01667           /* JEP 9/96, Bob McGowan 10/97
01668              A branch register which used as a jsr src is not live over the
01669              call.  Therefore a caller save register can be used.
01670              If the branch register is live-in on the op following the call,
01671              then a callee register should be used. */
01672           if (vreg->type == R_BTR)
01673             {
01674               if (Set_in (vreg->live_range, cur_jsr->id))
01675                 {
01676                   L_Oper *jsr_next_oper;
01677 
01678                   jsr_next_oper = cur_jsr->next_op;
01679 
01680                   if ((jsr_next_oper == NULL) ||
01681                       Set_in (vreg->live_range, jsr_next_oper->id))
01682                     {
01683                       jsr_cost += cur_jsr->weight;
01684                       vreg->flags |= R_CONTAINS_JSR;
01685                     }
01686                 }
01687             }
01688           else if (Set_in (vreg->live_range, cur_jsr->id))
01689             {
01690               jsr_cost += cur_jsr->weight;
01691               vreg->flags |= R_CONTAINS_JSR;
01692             }
01693         }
01694       if (vreg->flags & R_CONTAINS_JSR)
01695         {
01696           if (vreg->flags & R_PREALLOCATED_FLYBY)
01697             {
01698               L_Region_Regmap *regmap;
01699 
01700               regmap = L_find_region_regmap (region, vreg->index);
01701               if (regmap)
01702                 {
01703                   ref_weight = regmap->ref_weight;
01704                   if (regmap->jsr_weight > jsr_cost)
01705                     jsr_cost = regmap->jsr_weight;
01706                   if (regmap->phys_reg != -1)
01707                     {
01708                       if (regmap->type == R_CALLER ||
01709                           regmap->type == R_MACRO_CALLER)
01710                         {
01711                           /*
01712                              fprintf(stdout,"FOUND FLYBY WITH JSR\n");
01713                            */
01714                           vreg->flags &= ~(R_PREALLOCATED_FLYBY);
01715                           vreg->flags |= R_REGION_CONSTRAINED;
01716                         }
01717                     }
01718                 }
01719             }
01720           else
01721             {
01722               L_Region_Regmap *regmap;
01723 
01724               regmap = L_find_region_regmap (region, vreg->index);
01725               if (regmap)
01726                 ref_weight = regmap->ref_weight;
01727               if (regmap && (regmap->jsr_weight > jsr_cost))
01728                 jsr_cost = regmap->jsr_weight;
01729             }
01730 
01731         }
01732       else
01733         {
01734           L_Region_Regmap *regmap;
01735 
01736           regmap = L_find_region_regmap (region, vreg->index);
01737           if (regmap)
01738             ref_weight = regmap->ref_weight;
01739           if (regmap && (regmap->jsr_weight > jsr_cost))
01740             jsr_cost = regmap->jsr_weight;
01741         }
01742 
01743       switch (vreg->type)
01744         {
01745         case R_PREDICATE:
01746           index = 0;
01747           break;
01748         case R_INT:
01749           index = 1;
01750           break;
01751         case R_FLOAT:
01752           index = 2;
01753           break;
01754         case R_DOUBLE:
01755           index = 3;
01756           break;
01757         case R_BTR:
01758           index = (M_arch == M_TAHOE) ? 4 : 1;
01759           break;
01760         case R_POINTER:
01761           index = (M_arch == M_STARCORE) ? 5 :1;
01762           break;
01763         default:
01764           index = -1;
01765           L_punt ("Regalloc: Undefined register type index");
01766           break;
01767         }
01768 
01769       if (ref_weight < 0.0)
01770         spill_weight = (vreg->def_weight + 1) * spill_store_cost[index] +
01771           (vreg->ref_weight - vreg->def_weight + 1) * spill_load_cost[index];
01772       else
01773         spill_weight = ref_weight * spill_store_cost[index];
01774 
01775       /*
01776          rec_weight = R_determine_reconcile_cost(region,vreg,
01777          spill_store_cost+index,
01778          spill_load_cost+index);
01779 
01780        */
01781 
01782       /*
01783        * Determine benefit of allocation to caller/callee saved registers
01784        */
01785 
01786       caller_benefit = spill_weight /*+ rec_weight */  -
01787         ((jsr_cost + 0.5) * caller_cost[index]);
01788       callee_benefit = spill_weight /*+ rec_weight */  -
01789         ((fn->weight + 1.0) * callee_cost[index]);
01790 
01791       if (R_Print_Class_Selection)
01792         {
01793           fprintf (stderr, "VREG #%d reg_wgt = %f jsr_cost = %f",
01794                    vreg->index, vreg->ref_weight, jsr_cost);
01795           fprintf (stderr, " caller_benefit = %f callee_benefit = %f",
01796                    caller_benefit, callee_benefit);
01797 
01798           fprintf (stderr, "\n");
01799         }
01800 
01801       /* Assign virtual register caller save benefit */
01802 
01803       /* Caller/callee selection preferences are preformed twice: The
01804          first time, <caller_benefit> and <callee_benefit> are used and
01805          if a callee register is chosen, <callee_benefit2> is used
01806          thereafter.
01807          
01808          To handle the case where <callee_benefit> may be much lower than
01809          <callee_benefit2>, a better allocation may be achieved if we
01810          "force" a register to be preferred callee.  Thus the selections
01811          are made using <caller_benefit> and <callee_benefit2>, with a
01812          small correction to <total_benefit2> to account for the one
01813          callee register with benefit <callee_benefit>.
01814          
01815          The preference selection with the largest benefit is chosen. */
01816 
01817       /* Assign virtual register callee save benefit */
01818 
01819       if (caller_benefit >= 0.0)
01820         {
01821           if (callee_benefit >= 0.0)
01822             {
01823               if (caller_benefit - callee_benefit >= caller_callee_threshold)
01824                 {
01825                   vreg->caller_benefit = 1;
01826                   vreg->callee_benefit = 0;
01827                   pref_alloc1[i] = R_CALLER;
01828                   total_benefit1 += caller_benefit;
01829                 }
01830               else
01831                 {
01832                   vreg->caller_benefit = 0;
01833                   vreg->callee_benefit = 1;
01834                   pref_alloc1[i] = R_CALLEE;
01835                   total_benefit1 += callee_benefit;
01836                   callee_allocated1 = 1;
01837                 }
01838             }
01839           else
01840             {
01841               vreg->caller_benefit = 1;
01842               vreg->callee_benefit = -1;
01843               pref_alloc1[i] = R_CALLER;
01844               total_benefit1 += caller_benefit;
01845             }
01846         }
01847       else if (callee_benefit >= 0.0)
01848         {
01849           vreg->caller_benefit = -1;
01850           vreg->callee_benefit = 1;
01851           pref_alloc1[i] = R_CALLEE;
01852           total_benefit1 += callee_benefit;
01853           callee_allocated1 = 1;
01854         }
01855       else
01856         {
01857           vreg->caller_benefit = -1;
01858           vreg->callee_benefit = -1;
01859           pref_alloc1[i] = R_PREFER_SPILL;
01860         }
01861       /* increment virtual register count */
01862       i += 1;
01863     }
01864 
01865   pref_alloc = pref_alloc1;
01866 
01867 
01868   if (R_Print_Class_Selection)
01869     fprintf (stderr, "\nAllocation benefit: %f\n", total_benefit1);
01870 
01871   i = 0;
01872   for (vreg = R_vreg; vreg != NULL; vreg = vreg->nextReg)
01873     {
01874       if (vreg->flags & R_PREALLOCATED_MACRO)
01875         continue;
01876 
01877       vreg->rclass = pref_alloc[i];
01878 
01879       i += 1;
01880       if (R_Print_Class_Selection)
01881         {
01882           fprintf (stderr, "VREG #%d", vreg->index);
01883 
01884           switch (vreg->rclass)
01885             {
01886             case R_CALLER:
01887               fprintf (stderr, " prefer-caller\n");
01888               break;
01889             case R_CALLEE:
01890               fprintf (stderr, " prefer-callee\n");
01891               break;
01892             default:
01893               fprintf (stderr, " prefer to spill\n");
01894               break;
01895             }
01896         }
01897     }
01898 
01899   /* SAM 3-97 - Hack added for Playdoh emulation.  The problem is with
01900      emulion of scheduled code , function calls to Impact_Update() are
01901      inserted in phase3 (after allocation), thus any caller registers
01902      spanning these funct calls will not be saved/restored properly.
01903      Here any vregs that prefer caller regs are changed to callee or
01904      spill to prevent the problem.  I wasn't sure how to tell if the
01905      liverange spanned a call to Impact_Update(), the check if the
01906      ref_cbs > 1 seemed like a reasonable approximation. */
01907 
01908   if ((M_model == M_HP_PLAYDOH_MCODE) &&
01909       (L_EXTRACT_BIT_VAL (fn->flags, L_FUNC_SCHEDULED)))
01910     {
01911       for (vreg = R_vreg; vreg != NULL; vreg = vreg->nextReg)
01912         {
01913           if ((vreg->rclass == R_CALLER) && (Set_size (vreg->ref_cbs) > 1))
01914             {
01915               vreg->caller_benefit = -1;
01916               vreg->rclass = (vreg->callee_benefit > -1) ? R_CALLEE : R_SPILL;
01917             }
01918         }
01919     }
01920 
01921   free (pref_alloc1);
01922   free (pref_alloc2);
01923   if (callee_benefit2)
01924     free (callee_benefit2);
01925 
01926   return;
01927 }
01928 
01929 
01930 void
01931 R_determine_reserved_registers (Set * reserved_resource,
01932                                 Set * constrained_resource,
01933                                 int *constrained_array, R_Reg * vreg)
01934 {
01935   int i, j;
01936   unsigned int k;
01937   int *neighbor = R_buf;
01938   R_Arc *arc;
01939   Set rres = NULL, cres = NULL;
01940   L_Region_Regmap *regmap;
01941 
01942   /* find simultaineously live "live ranges" */
01943 
01944   for (arc = vreg->interfere, i = 0; arc; arc = arc->next)
01945     neighbor[i++] = arc->lr->index;
01946 
01947   /* and the virtual registers assigned to them if any */
01948   for (j = 0; j < i; j++)
01949     {
01950       R_Reg *tvreg = VREG (neighbor[j]);
01951       if (tvreg->base_index != -1)
01952         {
01953           for (k = 0; k < tvreg->size; k++)
01954             rres = Set_add (rres, tvreg->base_index + k);
01955         }
01956       if (tvreg->flags & R_REGION_CONSTRAINED)
01957         {
01958           regmap = L_find_region_regmap (R_Region, tvreg->index);
01959           cres = Set_add (cres, regmap->phys_reg);
01960         }
01961     }
01962   /* Handle PA-RISC restrictions on single precision 5-ops */
01963   if (vreg->flags & R_PA_HACK)
01964     rres = Set_union_acc (rres, R_pa_set);
01965 
01966   /* Handle illegal registers */
01967   rres = Set_union_acc (rres, vreg->illegal_reg);
01968 
01969   /* 
01970    * Handle constraints imposed by previously allocated regions 
01971    */
01972   if (!(vreg->flags & R_SPILLED))
01973     {
01974       regmap = L_find_region_regmap (R_Region, vreg->index);
01975       if (regmap != NULL)
01976         rres = Set_union_acc (rres, regmap->occupied);
01977     }
01978   *reserved_resource = rres;
01979   *constrained_resource = cres;
01980 }
01981 
01982 /*===========================================================================
01983  *
01984  *      Func :  R_conv_type_to_Ltype()
01985  *      Desc :  Converts a register allocator specific type (R_INT, etc.) to
01986  *              its equivalent Lcode type (L_CTYPE_INT,etc.)
01987  *      Input:  int type        - regalloc specific type 
01988  *      Output: Lcode type 
01989  *
01990  *      Side Effects: none 
01991  *
01992  *===========================================================================*/
01993 int
01994 R_conv_type_to_Ltype (int type)
01995 {
01996   switch (type)
01997     {
01998     case R_INT:
01999       return (M_native_int_register_ctype ());
02000     case R_FLOAT:
02001       return (L_CTYPE_FLOAT);
02002     case R_DOUBLE:
02003       return (L_CTYPE_DOUBLE);
02004     case R_PREDICATE:
02005       return (L_CTYPE_PREDICATE);
02006     case R_BTR:
02007       return (L_CTYPE_BTR);
02008     case R_POINTER:
02009       return (L_CTYPE_POINTER);
02010     case R_QUAD:
02011     default:
02012       L_punt ("RA (R_conv_type_to_Ltype): invalid bank type");
02013       return (0);
02014     }
02015 }
02016 
02017 int
02018 R_conv_rclass_to_Lclass (int rclass)
02019 {
02020   switch (rclass)
02021     {
02022     case R_MACRO_CALLER:
02023     case R_MACRO_CALLEE:
02024       return (L_OPERAND_MACRO);
02025     case R_CALLER:
02026     case R_CALLEE:
02027       return (L_OPERAND_REGISTER);
02028     default:
02029       L_punt ("RA (R_conv_rclass_to_Lclass): invalid register class");
02030       return (0);
02031     }
02032 }
02033 
02034 int
02035 R_Ltype_to_Rtype (int type)
02036 {
02037   switch (type)
02038     {
02039     case L_CTYPE_LLONG:
02040     case L_CTYPE_INT:
02041       return (R_INT);
02042     case L_CTYPE_FLOAT:
02043       return (R_FLOAT);
02044     case L_CTYPE_DOUBLE:
02045       return (R_DOUBLE);
02046     case L_CTYPE_PREDICATE:
02047       return (R_PREDICATE);
02048     case L_CTYPE_BTR:
02049       return (R_BTR);
02050     case L_CTYPE_POINTER:
02051       return (R_POINTER);
02052     default:
02053       L_punt ("RA (R_Ltype_to_Rtype): invalid ctype");
02054       return (0);
02055     }
02056 }
02057 
02058 
02059 char *
02060 BANK_NAME (int type)
02061 {
02062   switch (type)
02063     {
02064     case R_INT:
02065       return ("INT");
02066     case R_PREDICATE:
02067       return ("PREDICATE");
02068     case R_FLOAT:
02069       return ("FLOAT");
02070     case R_DOUBLE:
02071       return ("DOUBLE");
02072     case R_QUAD:
02073       return ("QUAD");
02074     case R_BTR:
02075       return ("BTR");
02076     case R_POINTER:
02077       return ("POINTER");
02078     default:
02079       return ("??");
02080     }
02081 }
02082 
02083 char *
02084 CLASS_NAME (int rclass)
02085 {
02086   switch (rclass)
02087     {
02088     case R_CALLER:
02089       return ("CALLER");
02090     case R_CALLEE:
02091       return ("CALLEE");
02092     case R_MACRO_CALLER:
02093       return ("CALLER MACRO");
02094     case R_MACRO_CALLEE:
02095       return ("CALLEE MACRO");
02096     case R_SPILL:
02097       return ("SPILL");
02098     default:
02099       return ("??");
02100     }
02101 }
02102 
02103 void
02104 R_sort_vreg_list (void)
02105 {
02106   Heap *sortHeap = Heap_Create (HEAP_MAX);
02107   R_Reg *vreg;
02108   int int_base, int_num, flt_base, flt_num, dbl_base, dbl_num, pred_base,
02109     pred_num;
02110   int nth_rot_reg;
02111 
02112   R_get_rot_regs (L_fn, &int_base, &int_num, &flt_base, &flt_num,
02113                   &dbl_base, &dbl_num, &pred_base, &pred_num);
02114 
02115   for (vreg = R_vreg; vreg != NULL; vreg = vreg->nextReg)
02116     {
02117       Heap_Insert (sortHeap, vreg, (double) vreg->index);
02118 
02119       if (vreg->type == R_INT)
02120         {
02121           nth_rot_reg = vreg->index - int_base;
02122           if (nth_rot_reg >= 0 && nth_rot_reg < int_num)
02123             {
02124               vreg->rotating = 1;
02125               vreg->nth_rot_reg = nth_rot_reg;
02126             }
02127         }
02128       else if (vreg->type == R_FLOAT)
02129         {
02130           nth_rot_reg = vreg->index - flt_base;
02131           if (nth_rot_reg >= 0 && nth_rot_reg < flt_num)
02132             {
02133               vreg->rotating = 1;
02134               vreg->nth_rot_reg = nth_rot_reg;
02135             }
02136         }
02137       else if (vreg->type == R_DOUBLE)
02138         {
02139           nth_rot_reg = vreg->index - dbl_base;
02140           if (nth_rot_reg >= 0 && nth_rot_reg < dbl_num)
02141             {
02142               vreg->rotating = 1;
02143               vreg->nth_rot_reg = nth_rot_reg;
02144             }
02145         }
02146       else if (vreg->type == R_PREDICATE)
02147         {
02148           nth_rot_reg = vreg->index - pred_base;
02149           if (nth_rot_reg >= 0 && nth_rot_reg < pred_num)
02150             {
02151               vreg->rotating = 1;
02152               vreg->nth_rot_reg = nth_rot_reg;
02153             }
02154         }
02155     }
02156 
02157   R_vreg = NULL;
02158 
02159   while ((vreg = (R_Reg *) Heap_ExtractTop (sortHeap)) != NULL)
02160     {
02161       vreg->nextReg = R_vreg;
02162       R_vreg = vreg;
02163     }
02164 
02165   Heap_Dispose (sortHeap, NULL);
02166 
02167   return;
02168 }
02169 
02170 int
02171 R_init_pa_set (void)
02172 {
02173   int float_caller_base, float_callee_base;
02174 
02175   R_pa_set = NULL;
02176 
02177   float_caller_base = R_bank[R_FLOAT + R_CALLER].base_index;
02178   float_callee_base = R_bank[R_FLOAT + R_CALLEE].base_index;
02179 
02180   /* CALLER SAVES */
02181   R_pa_set = Set_add (R_pa_set, float_caller_base + 0); /* 8L */
02182   R_pa_set = Set_add (R_pa_set, float_caller_base + 1); /* 8R */
02183   R_pa_set = Set_add (R_pa_set, float_caller_base + 2); /* 9L */
02184   R_pa_set = Set_add (R_pa_set, float_caller_base + 3); /* 9R */
02185   R_pa_set = Set_add (R_pa_set, float_caller_base + 4); /*10L */
02186   R_pa_set = Set_add (R_pa_set, float_caller_base + 5); /*10R */
02187   R_pa_set = Set_add (R_pa_set, float_caller_base + 6); /*11L */
02188   R_pa_set = Set_add (R_pa_set, float_caller_base + 7); /*11R */
02189 
02190   /* CALLEE SAVES */
02191   R_pa_set = Set_add (R_pa_set, float_callee_base + 0); /*12L */
02192   R_pa_set = Set_add (R_pa_set, float_callee_base + 1); /*12R */
02193   R_pa_set = Set_add (R_pa_set, float_callee_base + 2); /*13L */
02194   R_pa_set = Set_add (R_pa_set, float_callee_base + 3); /*13R */
02195   R_pa_set = Set_add (R_pa_set, float_callee_base + 4); /*14L */
02196   R_pa_set = Set_add (R_pa_set, float_callee_base + 5); /*14R */
02197   R_pa_set = Set_add (R_pa_set, float_callee_base + 6); /*15L */
02198   R_pa_set = Set_add (R_pa_set, float_callee_base + 7); /*15R */
02199 
02200   return (0);
02201 }
02202 
02203 /*===========================================================================
02204  *
02205  *      Func :  R_compute_dataflow_info() 
02206  *      Desc :  Dataflow information is constructed in two phases.
02207  *              Phase 1 defines the dataflow graph from the <R_instr> 
02208  *              information and then reaching definition analysis is 
02209  *              performed.
02210  *              Phase 2 scans for jsr instructions and each jsr is made to
02211  *              define every available caller saved macro register and the
02212  *              previously determined reaching definitions are used to 
02213  *              force every jsr to use only those macro registers whose
02214  *              definitions reach the jsr instruction. 
02215  *      Input:  none
02216  *      Output: none 
02217  *
02218  *      Side Effects:  calculates dataflow information 
02219  *
02220  *===========================================================================*/
02221 void
02222 R_compute_dataflow_info (L_Func * fn)
02223 {
02224   L_Oper *oper;
02225   L_Attr *attr;
02226   R_Reg *vreg;
02227   int j, n_extend, vreg_id;
02228   int macro, macro_type;
02229 
02230   int *extend_opers = R_buf2;
02231 
02232   n_extend = Set_2array (R_extend_set, extend_opers);
02233 
02234   /* Handle macroregisters used and defined by each subroutine call */
02235   List_start (R_jsr_list);
02236   while ((oper = (L_Oper *)List_next (R_jsr_list)))
02237     {
02238       if (oper->opc == Lop_JSR_ND)
02239         continue;
02240
