02241       for (j = 0; j < R_n_jsr_def_macro; j++)
02242         {
02243           L_add_dest_operand_reg (oper, R_jsr_def_macro[j].vreg_id, FALSE,
02244                                   FALSE);
02245 
02246           vreg = VREG(R_jsr_def_macro[j].vreg_id);
02247 
02248           vreg->def_instr = Set_add (vreg->def_instr, 
02249                                      oper->id);
02250         }
02251 
02252       if ((attr = L_find_attr (oper->attr, "tr")))
02253         {
02254           int k;
02255           for (k = 0; k < attr->max_field; k++)
02256             {
02257               macro = attr->field[k]->value.mac;
02258               macro_type =
02259                 R_Ltype_to_Rtype (L_return_old_ctype (attr->field[k]));
02260 
02261               vreg_id = -1 - macro;
02262 
02263               for (j = 0; j < R_n_jsr_def_macro; j++)
02264                 if (R_jsr_def_macro[j].id == macro &&
02265                     R_jsr_def_macro[j].type == macro_type)
02266                   {
02267                     vreg_id = R_jsr_def_macro[j].vreg_id;
02268                     break;
02269                   }
02270 
02271               L_add_src_operand_reg (oper, vreg_id, FALSE, FALSE);
02272             }
02273         }
02274     }
02275 
02276   /* Handle macroregisters used by the rts */
02277   if (R_rts && (attr = L_find_attr (R_rts->attr, "tr")))
02278     {
02279       int k;
02280       for (k = 0; k < attr->max_field; k++)
02281         {
02282           macro = attr->field[k]->value.mac;
02283           macro_type =
02284             R_Ltype_to_Rtype (L_return_old_ctype (attr->field[k]));
02285 
02286           vreg_id = -1 - macro;
02287 
02288           for (j = 0; j < R_n_avail_macro; j++)
02289             if (R_avail_macro[j].id == macro &&
02290                 R_avail_macro[j].type == macro_type)
02291               {
02292                 vreg_id = R_avail_macro[j].vreg_id;
02293                 break;
02294               }
02295           
02296           L_add_src_operand_reg (R_rts, vreg_id, FALSE, FALSE);
02297         }
02298     }
02299 
02300   /* 
02301    * Perform Live Variable Analysis 
02302    * ----------------------------------------------------------------------
02303    * Use special critical variable mode for intereference graph construction.
02304    * An unconditional predicate definition must conflict with all live
02305    * predicates, not simply those live when its guard is TRUE.
02306    */
02307 
02308 #if 0
02309   L_dataflow_analysis (CRITICAL_VARIABLE | INTERFERENCE);
02310 #else
02311   L_dataflow_analysis (LIVE_VARIABLE | INTERFERENCE);
02312 #endif
02313 
02314 }
02315 
02316 
02317 /*===========================================================================
02318  *
02319  *      Func :  R_print_live_ranges()
02320  *      Desc :  Dumps the live ranges to a file
02321  *      Input:  none 
02322  *      Output: none
02323  *
02324  *      Side Effects: none
02325  *
02326  *===========================================================================*/
02327 void
02328 R_print_live_ranges (FILE * file)
02329 {
02330   R_Reg *vreg;
02331   R_Arc *arc;
02332 
02333   fprintf (file, "\n*** Function Live Ranges ***\n\n");
02334   for (vreg = R_vreg; vreg != NULL; vreg = vreg->nextReg)
02335     {
02336       fprintf (file,
02337                "Live Range #%d : class %d, type %d, rot %d, nth rot %d, "
02338                "%s\n\tLive insts: ",
02339                vreg->index, vreg->rclass, vreg->type, vreg->rotating,
02340                vreg->nth_rot_reg,
02341                ((vreg->flags & R_CONSTANT) ? "(Constant)" : ""));
02342       Set_print (file, "", vreg->live_range);
02343       fprintf (file, "\tInterfering vregs: ");
02344       arc = vreg->interfere;
02345       while (arc)
02346         {
02347           fprintf (file, "%d ", arc->lr->index);
02348           arc = arc->next;
02349         }
02350       fprintf (file, "\n");
02351     }
02352 }
02353 
02354 
02355 /*===========================================================================
02356  *
02357  *      Func :  R_compute_live_ranges()
02358  *      Desc :  Determines the live ranges of each virtual register by
02359  *              examining the computed live variable information 
02360  *      Input:  none 
02361  *      Output: none
02362  *
02363  *      Side Effects: defines <live_range> and <instr_weight> fields of
02364  *                    each defined R_Reg structure 
02365  *
02366  *===========================================================================*/
02367 void
02368 R_compute_live_ranges (L_Func * fn, L_Region * region)
02369 {
02370   int i, j, k, num, num_operand;
02371   int *live_in = R_buf;
02372   int n_oper, *oper_array = R_buf2;
02373   Set in, out;
02374   Set delete_oper = NULL;
02375   int *delete_oper_array = R_buf;
02376   int *def_oper;
02377   /* MDES flags of opers that are unsafe to delete */
02378   int unsafe_to_delete = OP_FLAG_CBR | OP_FLAG_JMP | OP_FLAG_RTS |
02379     OP_FLAG_JSR | OP_FLAG_SYNC | OP_FLAG_CHK |
02380     OP_FLAG_STORE | OP_FLAG_IGNORE | OP_FLAG_MEMCOPY;
02381 
02382   R_Reg *vreg;
02383 
02384   n_oper = Set_2array (R_oper_set, oper_array);
02385 
02386   def_oper = (int *) malloc (sizeof (int) * n_oper);
02387 
02388   for (i = 0; i < n_oper; i++)
02389     {
02390       int live_dest = 0, mac_dest = 0, reg_dest = 0;
02391       int oper_id = oper_array[i];
02392       L_Oper *oper = L_oper_hash_tbl_find_oper (fn->oper_hash_tbl, oper_id);
02393       L_Cb *cb = L_oper_hash_tbl_find_cb (fn->oper_hash_tbl, oper_id);
02394 
02395       /*
02396        * Perform global dead code removal to avoid live range
02397        * and interference graph problems caused by unused
02398        * virtual register definitions
02399        */
02400 
02401       out = (Set) L_get_oper_OUT_set (cb, oper, BOTH_PATHS);
02402 
02403       num_operand = L_max_dest_operand;
02404       for (j = 0; j < num_operand; j++)
02405         {
02406           L_Operand *dest;
02407           if (!(dest = oper->dest[j]))
02408             continue;
02409 
02410           vreg = VREG (dest->value.r);
02411 
02412           /*
02413            * REH 3/13/95 Correction to generate proper 
02414            * macro lifetime in the presence of dead code.
02415            */
02416 
02417           if (L_is_reg (dest))
02418             {
02419               if (vreg->rclass == R_MACRO_CALLER ||
02420                   vreg->rclass == R_MACRO_CALLEE)
02421                 {
02422                   mac_dest++;
02423                 }
02424               else
02425                 {
02426                   reg_dest = 1;
02427 
02428                   if (Set_in (out, dest->value.r))
02429                     {
02430                       live_dest++;
02431                     }
02432                   else if (L_general_pred_comparison_opcode (oper) &&
02433                            L_is_ctype_predicate (dest))
02434                     {
02435                       if (R_Print_Dead_Code_Results)
02436                         {
02437                           fprintf (stderr, "RA eliding pred dest %d\n", j);
02438                           L_print_oper (stdout, oper);
02439                         }
02440                       L_delete_operand (dest);
02441                       oper->dest[j] = NULL;
02442                     }
02443                 }
02444             }
02445           else if (L_is_macro (dest) &&
02446                    (!L_is_ctype_predicate (dest) ||
02447                     M_dataflow_macro (dest->value.mac)))
02448             {
02449               mac_dest++;
02450             }
02451         }
02452 
02453       if (reg_dest && !live_dest)
02454         {
02455           /* If none of the virtual register destinations were live out,
02456            * the oper may be safe to delete.  If it is not safe to
02457            * delete, add the oper to the dest vreg live ranges to
02458            * guarantee a conflict-free allocation.
02459            */
02460 
02461           if (R_Allow_Dead_Code_Elimination && !mac_dest &&
02462               !op_flag_set (oper->proc_opc, unsafe_to_delete))
02463             {
02464               if (R_Print_Dead_Code_Results)
02465                 {
02466                   fprintf (stdout, "RA: eliding dead code oper\n");
02467                   L_print_oper (stdout, oper);
02468                 }
02469               /* Remember oper for deleting oper later */
02470               delete_oper = Set_add (delete_oper, oper->id);
02471             }
02472           else
02473             {
02474               for (k = 0; k < num_operand; k++)
02475                 {
02476                   L_Operand *dest;
02477                   if (!(dest = oper->dest[k]))
02478                     continue;
02479                   
02480                   if (L_is_reg (dest))
02481                     {
02482                       R_Reg *tmp_vreg = VREG (dest->value.r);
02483                       tmp_vreg->live_range =
02484                         Set_add (tmp_vreg->live_range, oper->id);
02485                     }
02486                 }
02487             }
02488         }
02489 
02490       /* end of global dead code removal */
02491 
02492       in = L_get_oper_IN_set (oper);
02493       num = Set_2array (in, live_in);
02494 
02495       for (k = 0; k < num; k++)
02496         {
02497           if (live_in[k] < 0)
02498             continue;
02499           
02500           vreg = VREG (live_in[k]);
02501           vreg->live_range = (Set) Set_add (vreg->live_range, oper->id);
02502           vreg->instr_weight += 1;
02503         }
02504     }
02505 
02506   free (def_oper);
02507 
02508   /* Now, delete the opers selected as dead code */
02509 
02510   if (R_Allow_Dead_Code_Elimination)
02511     {
02512       n_oper = Set_2array (delete_oper, delete_oper_array);
02513       for (i = 0; i < n_oper; i++)
02514         {
02515           int oper_id = delete_oper_array[i];
02516           L_Oper *oper = L_oper_hash_tbl_find_oper (fn->oper_hash_tbl, 
02517                                                     oper_id);
02518           L_Cb *cb = L_oper_hash_tbl_find_cb (fn->oper_hash_tbl, oper_id);
02519 
02520           /* 20020829 SZU
02521            * Nullify for TAHOE arch only
02522            */
02523           if ((!L_EXTRACT_BIT_VAL (cb->flags, L_CB_SOFTPIPE) &&
02524                !L_find_attr (cb->attr, "kernel")) || (M_arch != M_TAHOE))
02525             L_delete_oper (cb, oper);
02526           else
02527             L_nullify_operation (oper);
02528         }
02529       Set_dispose (delete_oper);
02530     }
02531 
02532   if (R_Print_Live_Ranges)
02533     R_print_live_ranges (stdout);
02534 }
02535 
02536 void
02537 R_print_interference_graph (void)
02538 {
02539   int count, num_int, type1, type2;
02540   R_Arc *arc;
02541   R_Reg *vreg;
02542 
02543   fprintf (stderr, "*\n* Virtual Register Interference Graph\n*\n");
02544 
02545   for (vreg = R_vreg; vreg != NULL; vreg = vreg->nextReg)
02546     {
02547       type1 = R_smallest_overlapping_bank (vreg->type, R_CALLER);
02548 
02549       num_int = 0;
02550       for (arc = vreg->interfere; arc != NULL; arc = arc->next)
02551         {
02552           type2 = R_smallest_overlapping_bank (arc->lr->type, R_CALLER);
02553           if (type1 == type2)
02554             num_int += 1;
02555         }
02556 
02557       fprintf (stderr, "VReg #%d (%s), %d interferences:\n",
02558                vreg->index, BANK_NAME (vreg->type), num_int);
02559 
02560       count = 0;
02561       fprintf (stderr, "\t\t");
02562       for (arc = vreg->interfere; arc != NULL; arc = arc->next)
02563         {
02564           type2 = R_smallest_overlapping_bank (arc->lr->type, R_CALLER);
02565           if (type1 == type2)
02566             {
02567               fprintf (stderr, "%d ", arc->lr->index);
02568               if (count++ == 9)
02569                 {
02570                   fprintf (stderr, "\n\t\t");
02571                   count = 0;
02572                 }
02573             }
02574         }
02575       fprintf (stderr, "\n\n");
02576     }
02577 }
02578 
02579 void
02580 R_add_interference_arc (R_Reg * from, R_Reg * to)
02581 {
02582   R_Arc *new_arc;
02583 
02584   if (!from || !to)
02585     L_punt ("R_add_interference_arc: NULL R_Reg");
02586 
02587   new_arc = (R_Arc *) L_alloc (R_alloc_interference_arc);
02588   new_arc->lr = from;
02589   new_arc->next = to->interfere;
02590   to->interfere = new_arc;
02591 }
02592 
02593 
02594 /*===========================================================================
02595  *
02596  *      Func :  R_construct_interference_graph()
02597  *      Desc :  Creates an interfernce graph node for each virtual register
02598  *              with weight <ref_weight>^3/<instr_weight>.  An arc is 
02599  *              created between two nodes if it is determined that there
02600  *              live ranges overlap(intersect). 
02601  *      Input:  none 
02602  *      Output: 
02603  *
02604  *      Side Effects: adds interference arcs to <interfere> field of the
02605  *                    R_Reg structure
02606  *
02607  *===========================================================================*/
02608 void
02609 R_construct_interference_graph (L_Func *fn, L_Region * region)
02610 {
02611   R_Reg *r1, *r2;
02612   int use_invariant_priorities = R_Invariant_Vreg_Priorities;
02613   int *buf = NULL, bufsz = 0, sz, j;
02614 
02615   /*
02616    * Construct interference arcs
02617    *
02618    * This is done by comparing each pair of virtual registers to
02619    * determine if there is an intersection between their respective 
02620    * live ranges, if so two interference arcs are created.
02621    */
02622 
02623   for (r1 = R_vreg; r1; r1 = r1->nextReg)
02624     {
02625       Set intf = NULL;
02626 
02627       /* Calculate virtual register priority */
02628       if (!use_invariant_priorities)
02629         {
02630           if (r1->instr_weight != 0)
02631             r1->priority =
02632               (r1->ref_weight * r1->ref_weight * r1->ref_weight) /
02633               (double) r1->instr_weight;
02634           else
02635             r1->priority = 0.0;
02636         }
02637       else
02638         {
02639           r1->priority = (double) r1->index;
02640         }
02641 
02642       sz = Set_size (r1->def_instr);
02643 
02644       if (sz > bufsz)
02645         {
02646           bufsz = sz < 16 ? 32 : (2 * sz);
02647           if (buf)
02648             free (buf);
02649           buf = Lcode_malloc (bufsz * sizeof (int));
02650         }
02651 
02652       /* r1 interferes with r2 iff a definition of r1 occurs
02653        * at a point where r2 is live, or a definition of r2 occurs
02654        * where r1 is live.
02655        */
02656 
02657       Set_2array (r1->def_instr, buf);
02658 
02659       for (j = 0; j < sz; j++)
02660         {
02661           L_Oper *oper;
02662           L_Cb *cb;
02663 
02664           if (!(oper = L_oper_hash_tbl_find_oper (fn->oper_hash_tbl, buf[j])))
02665             continue;
02666 
02667           cb = L_oper_hash_tbl_find_cb (fn->oper_hash_tbl, buf[j]);
02668 
02669           intf = Set_union_acc (intf, 
02670                                 L_get_oper_OUT_set (cb, oper, BOTH_PATHS));
02671         }
02672 
02673       /* Add precomputed interferences */
02674 
02675       intf = Set_union_acc (intf, r1->intf_vreg);
02676 
02677       /* Draw arcs */
02678 
02679       for (r2 = R_vreg; r2; r2 = r2->nextReg)
02680         {
02681           if (r1 == r2)
02682             continue;
02683 
02684           if (Set_in (intf, r2->index) && !R_find_interference (r1, r2))
02685             {
02686               R_add_interference_arc (r2, r1);
02687               R_add_interference_arc (r1, r2);
02688             }
02689         }
02690 
02691       intf = Set_dispose (intf);
02692     }
02693 
02694   if (buf)
02695     free (buf);
02696 
02697   if (R_Print_Interference_Graph)
02698     {
02699       DB_spit_func (fn, "INTFG");
02700       R_print_interference_graph ();
02701     }
02702 
02703   return;
02704 }
02705 
02706 /*===========================================================================
02707  *
02708  *      Func :  R_remove_interference()
02709  *      Desc :  Removes the interference arcs between two live ranges in
02710  *              the interference graph.
02711  *      Input:  vreg1, vreg2 - two no longer interfering live ranges 
02712  *      Output: 
02713  *
02714  *      Side Effects: none
02715  *
02716  *===========================================================================*/
02717 void
02718 R_remove_interference (R_Reg * vreg1, R_Reg * vreg2)
02719 {
02720   R_Arc *arc, *prev_arc;
02721 
02722   for (arc = prev_arc = vreg1->interfere; arc != NULL; arc = arc->next)
02723     {
02724       if (arc->lr != vreg2)
02725         {
02726           prev_arc = arc;
02727           continue;
02728         }
02729 
02730       if (arc != prev_arc)
02731         prev_arc->next = arc->next;
02732       else                      /* prev_arc = arc */
02733         vreg1->interfere = arc->next;
02734 
02735       L_free (R_alloc_interference_arc, arc);
02736       break;
02737     }
02738 }
02739 
02740 R_Arc *
02741 R_find_interference (R_Reg * vreg1, R_Reg * vreg2)
02742 {
02743   R_Arc *arc;
02744 
02745   for (arc = vreg1->interfere; arc != NULL; arc = arc->next)
02746     {
02747       if (arc->lr == vreg2)
02748         return (arc);
02749     }
02750   return (NULL);
02751 }
02752 
02753 /*===========================================================================
02754  *
02755  *      Func :  R_prune_interference_graph()
02756  *      Desc :  Removes live ranges from the interference graph whose number
02757  *              of interferences is less than the number of available registers
02758  *              of that type.  A live range is removed only of both caller and
02759  *              callee saved benefits are > 0.0.
02760  *      Input:  
02761  *      Output: 
02762  *
02763  *      Side Effects: reduction of the interference graph
02764  *
02765  *===========================================================================*/
02766 Stack *unconstrained_vreg = NULL;
02767 
02768 static void
02769 R_prune_interference_graph (void)
02770 {
02771   int cnt = 0, change;
02772   R_Reg *vreg;
02773   R_Arc *arc;
02774   int num;
02775   /*
02776      unconstrained_vreg = New_Stack();
02777    */
02778 #if 0
02779   fprintf (stdout, "Pruning interference graph.\n");
02780 #endif
02781   for (vreg = R_vreg; vreg; vreg = vreg->nextReg)
02782     vreg->flags = vreg->flags & (~R_UNCONSTRAINED);
02783 
02784   while (((long int) (vreg = (R_Reg *) Pop (unconstrained_vreg))) != -1);
02785 
02786   change = 1;
02787   while (change)
02788     {
02789       change = 0;
02790       for (vreg = R_vreg; vreg != NULL; vreg = vreg->nextReg)
02791         {
02792 
02793           if (vreg->flags & R_UNCONSTRAINED)
02794             continue;
02795 
02796           /* my HP-PA hack */
02797           if (vreg->flags & R_PA_HACK)
02798             continue;
02799 
02800           if (vreg->rclass == R_MACRO_CALLER ||
02801               vreg->rclass == R_MACRO_CALLEE)
02802             continue;
02803 
02804           if (vreg->caller_benefit < 0 || vreg->callee_benefit < 0)
02805             continue;
02806 
02807           cnt = 0;
02808 
02809           /* Account for the ill_reg's a vreg cannot be allocated to */
02810           cnt += Set_size (vreg->illegal_reg);
02811 
02812           for (arc = vreg->interfere; arc != NULL; arc = arc->next)
02813             {
02814               if (arc->lr->flags & R_UNCONSTRAINED)
02815                 continue;
02816 
02817               if (R_global_overlap[vreg->type] &&
02818                   R_global_overlap[arc->lr->type])
02819                 cnt += R_max_overlap_size[vreg->type];
02820             }
02821           num = R_bank[vreg->type + R_CALLER].num_reg *
02822             R_bank[vreg->type + R_CALLER].reg_size +
02823             R_bank[vreg->type + R_CALLEE].num_reg *
02824             R_bank[vreg->type + R_CALLEE].reg_size +
02825             R_bank[vreg->type + R_MACRO_CALLER].num_reg *
02826             R_bank[vreg->type + R_MACRO_CALLER].reg_size +
02827             R_bank[vreg->type + R_MACRO_CALLEE].num_reg *
02828             R_bank[vreg->type + R_MACRO_CALLEE].reg_size;
02829 
02830           if (cnt < num)
02831             {
02832               change = 1;
02833               vreg->flags |= R_UNCONSTRAINED;
02834 
02835               Push_Top (unconstrained_vreg, vreg);
02836             }
02837         }
02838     }
02839 }
02840 
02841 /*===========================================================================
02842  *
02843  *      Func :  R_allocate_unconstrained_virtual_registers()
02844  *      Desc :  Assigns physical registers to unconstrained virtual registers
02845  *              in the opposite order in which they were removed from the 
02846  *              interference graph.  If there is no available error, then a
02847  *              small, but major internal error has occurred.
02848  *      Input:  
02849  *      Output: 
02850  *
02851  *      Side Effects:  
02852  *
02853  *===========================================================================*/
02854 static int
02855 R_allocate_unconstrained_virtual_registers (void)
02856 {
02857   int free_register, *neighbor;
02858   R_Reg *vreg;
02859   Set reserved_resource;
02860   Set constrained_resource;
02861   Set tmp_reserved;
02862   int *constrained_array;
02863 
02864   neighbor = (int *) malloc (R_n_vreg * sizeof (int));
02865   constrained_array = (int *) malloc (sizeof (int) * R_n_vreg);
02866 
02867   while (((long int) (vreg = (R_Reg *) Pop (unconstrained_vreg))) != -1)
02868     {
02869       reserved_resource = NULL;
02870       constrained_resource = NULL;
02871       R_determine_reserved_registers (&reserved_resource,
02872                                       &constrained_resource,
02873                                       constrained_array, vreg);
02874 
02875       tmp_reserved = Set_union (reserved_resource, constrained_resource);
02876       free_register = R_find_free_register (vreg, tmp_reserved, 1);
02877 
02878       if (free_register != -1)
02879         {
02880           /* live range is allocatable */
02881           vreg->base_index = free_register;
02882           vreg->size = (R_bank + vreg->type + vreg->rclass)->reg_size;
02883         }
02884       else
02885         L_punt ("RA: No free register for unconstrained vreg!!!!\n");
02886 
02887       reserved_resource = Set_dispose (reserved_resource);
02888     }
02889 
02890   /*
02891      Free_Stack(unconstrained_vreg);
02892    */
02893 
02894   free (neighbor);
02895   free (constrained_array);
02896 
02897   return (0);
02898 }
02899 
02900 /*===========================================================================
02901  *
02902  *      Func :  R_allocate_virtual_registers()
02903  *      Desc :  The heart of the register allocator.  Performs the allocation
02904  *              for all constrained virtual regs, using a hybrid combination
02905  *              of Chaitin's allocator and Chow's allocator. If you want to
02906  *              know how it works, ask Rick.
02907  *      Input:  
02908  *      Output: 
02909  *
02910  *      Side Effects:  
02911  *
02912  *===========================================================================*/
02913 void
02914 R_allocate_virtual_registers (L_Func * fn)
02915 {
02916   int uncolored, pass;
02917   int free_register;
02918   void *tmp;
02919   Heap *heap;
02920   Stack *shadow_stack;
02921   R_Reg *vreg;
02922   Set reserved_resource;
02923   Set constrained_resource;
02924   Set tmp_reserved;
02925   int *constrained_array;
02926 
02927   constrained_array = (int *) malloc (sizeof (int) * R_n_vreg);
02928 
02929   heap = Heap_Create (HEAP_MAX);
02930   shadow_stack = New_Stack ();
02931   unconstrained_vreg = New_Stack ();
02932 
02933   /* Scan and allocate the rotating registers. */
02934 
02935   for (vreg = R_vreg; vreg != NULL; vreg = vreg->nextReg)
02936     {
02937       if (vreg->rotating != 1)
02938         continue;
02939 
02940       /* Allocate these rotating registers outright. */
02941 
02942       reserved_resource = NULL;
02943       constrained_resource = NULL;
02944       R_determine_reserved_registers (&reserved_resource,
02945                                       &constrained_resource,
02946                                       constrained_array, vreg);
02947 
02948       tmp_reserved = Set_union (reserved_resource, constrained_resource);
02949       free_register = R_find_rotating_register (vreg, tmp_reserved, 1);
02950 
02951       if (R_Print_Coloring_Stats)
02952         {
02953           fprintf (stderr, "Coloring(R,C) %d\t-> %d\n", vreg->index,
02954                    free_register);
02955           fprintf (stderr, "\tWgt %f\n", vreg->priority);
02956           Set_print (stderr, "\tRR", reserved_resource);
02957           Set_print (stderr, "\tCR", constrained_resource);
02958         }
02959 
02960       Set_dispose (tmp_reserved);
02961 
02962       reserved_resource = Set_dispose (reserved_resource);
02963       constrained_resource = Set_dispose (constrained_resource);
02964 
02965       if (free_register != -1)
02966         {
02967           /* live range is allocatable */
02968           vreg->base_index = free_register;
02969           vreg->size = (R_bank + vreg->type + vreg->rclass)->reg_size;
02970         }
02971       else
02972         {
02973           L_punt ("R_allocate_virtual_registers: "
02974                   "Unable to color a rotating register.");
02975         }
02976     }
02977 
02978   /* Scan and color remaining registers */
02979 
02980   for (vreg = R_vreg; vreg != NULL; vreg = vreg->nextReg)
02981     {
02982       if (vreg->rotating == 1)
02983         continue;
02984 
02985       if (vreg->flags & R_PREALLOCATED_MACRO)
02986         continue;
02987 
02988       if (vreg->flags & R_PREALLOCATED_FLYBY &&
02989           !(vreg->flags & R_REGION_CONSTRAINED))
02990         continue;
02991 
02992 #if 0
02993       if ( vreg->flags & R_UNCONSTRAINED )
02994         continue;
02995 #endif
02996 
02997       Heap_Insert (heap, vreg, vreg->priority);
02998     }
02999 
03000   if (R_Print_Coloring_Stats)
03001     fprintf (stderr, "*** GRAPH COLORING STATISTICS ***\n\n");
03002 
03003   uncolored = 1;
03004   pass = 1;
03005   while (uncolored)
03006     {
03007       if (R_Print_Coloring_Stats)
03008         fprintf (stderr, "Coloring Pass %d\n", pass);
03009 
03010       if (R_Prune_Interference_Graph)
03011         R_prune_interference_graph ();
03012 
03013       uncolored = 0;
03014 
03015       tmp = Heap_Top (heap);
03016       if (tmp)
03017         Push_Top (shadow_stack, tmp);
03018 
03019       vreg = (R_Reg *) Heap_ExtractTop (heap);
03020 
03021       while (vreg != NULL)
03022         {
03023           if (vreg->flags & R_UNCONSTRAINED)
03024             {
03025               tmp = Heap_Top (heap);
03026               if (tmp)
03027                 Push_Top (shadow_stack, tmp);
03028 
03029               vreg = (R_Reg *) Heap_ExtractTop (heap);
03030               continue;
03031             }
03032 
03033           reserved_resource = NULL;
03034           constrained_resource = NULL;
03035           R_determine_reserved_registers (&reserved_resource,
03036                                           &constrained_resource,
03037                                           constrained_array, vreg);
03038 
03039           tmp_reserved = Set_union (reserved_resource, constrained_resource);
03040           free_register = R_find_free_register (vreg, tmp_reserved, 1);
03041 
03042           if (R_Print_Coloring_Stats)
03043             {
03044               fprintf (stderr, "Coloring(R,C) %d\t-> %d\n", vreg->index,
03045                        free_register);
03046               fprintf (stderr, "\tWgt %f\n", vreg->priority);
03047               Set_print (stderr, "\tRR", reserved_resource);
03048               Set_print (stderr, "\tCR", constrained_resource);
03049             }
03050 
03051           Set_dispose (tmp_reserved);
03052 
03053           reserved_resource = Set_dispose (reserved_resource);
03054           constrained_resource = Set_dispose (constrained_resource);
03055 
03056           if (free_register != -1)
03057             {
03058               /* live range is allocatable */
03059               vreg->base_index = free_register;
03060               vreg->size = (R_bank + vreg->type + vreg->rclass)->reg_size;
03061 
03062               /* additional code is required to allocate the constant
03063                  live range */
03064             }
03065           else
03066             {
03067               uncolored += 1;
03068 
03069               if (R_Print_Coloring_Stats)
03070                 fprintf (stderr, "Virtual register uncolored: %d\n",
03071                          vreg->index);
03072 
03073               R_handle_unallocatable_vreg (fn, vreg, shadow_stack);
03074             }
03075 
03076           tmp = Heap_Top (heap);
03077           if (tmp)
03078             Push_Top (shadow_stack, tmp);
03079 
03080           vreg = (R_Reg *) Heap_ExtractTop (heap);
03081         }
03082 
03083       if (uncolored)
03084         {
03085           R_Reg *tmp_vreg;
03086           while (((long int) (tmp_vreg = (R_Reg *) Pop (shadow_stack))) != -1)
03087             {
03088               tmp_vreg->base_index = -1;
03089 
03090               if (tmp_vreg->caller_benefit >= tmp_vreg->callee_benefit)
03091                 tmp_vreg->rclass = R_CALLER;
03092               else
03093                 tmp_vreg->rclass = R_CALLEE;
03094 
03095               if (!((tmp_vreg->flags & R_PREALLOCATED_FLYBY) &&
03096                     (tmp_vreg->flags & R_SPILLED)))
03097                 Heap_Insert (heap, tmp_vreg, tmp_vreg->priority);
03098 
03099             }
03100           if (R_Print_Coloring_Stats)
03101             fprintf (stderr, "\tUncolored registers: %d\n", uncolored);
03102 
03103           pass += 1;
03104 
03105           /* reset the register bank stacks */
03106           R_reset_register_stacks ();
03107         }
03108     }
03109   R_allocate_unconstrained_virtual_registers ();
03110 
03111   Heap_Dispose (heap, NULL);
03112   Free_Stack (shadow_stack);
03113   Free_Stack (unconstrained_vreg);
03114   free (constrained_array);
03115 }
03116 
03117 /*===========================================================================
03118  *
03119  *      Func :  R_spill_all_virtual_registers()
03120  *      Desc :  Assigns a physical register to all virtual registers. Since
03121  *              their live ranges consist only of defs and uses, they are
03122  *              all being spilled.
03123  *      Input:  
03124  *      Output: 
03125  *
03126  *
03127  *===========================================================================*/
03128 static void
03129 R_spill_all_virtual_registers (L_Func * fn, L_Region * region)
03130 {
03131   int i, l, free_register, *phys_map;
03132   L_Cb *cb;
03133   L_Oper *oper, *spill_instr, *next_op;
03134   R_Physical_Bank *bank;
03135   R_Reg *vreg;
03136   Set reserved_resource, src_vregs;
03137   Set pred_vregs;
03138   Set pred_resource;
03139   L_Attr *attr;
03140 
03141   pred_vregs = NULL;
03142   for (cb = fn->first_cb; cb != NULL; cb = cb->next_cb)
03143     {
03144       pred_resource = NULL;
03145       pred_vregs = NULL;
03146 
03147       for (oper = cb->first_op; oper != NULL; oper = next_op)
03148         {
03149           next_op = oper->next_op;
03150           /*
03151            * All other registers are live only during an operation
03152            */
03153 
03154           reserved_resource = Set_union (0, pred_resource);
03155 
03156           src_vregs = NULL;
03157 
03158           /* guard predicate */
03159 
03160           {
03161             L_Operand *pred;
03162             if ((pred = oper->pred[0]) &&
03163                 L_is_reg (pred))
03164               {
03165                 vreg = VREG (pred->value.r);
03166                 if (Set_in (pred_vregs, vreg->index))
03167                   {
03168                     free_register = vreg->base_index;
03169                   }
03170                 else
03171                   {
03172                     vreg->rclass = R_CALLER;
03173                     free_register =
03174                       R_find_free_register (vreg, reserved_resource, 1);
03175                     pred_vregs = Set_add (pred_vregs, vreg->index);
03176                   }
03177                 
03178                 if (free_register != -1)
03179                   {
03180                     vreg->base_index = free_register;
03181                     vreg->size =
03182                       (R_bank + vreg->type + vreg->rclass)->reg_size;
03183                     
03184                     /*
03185                      * Place register in the reserved resource set
03186                      */
03187                     for (l = 0; l < vreg->size; l++)
03188                       {
03189                         reserved_resource =
03190                           (Set) Set_add (reserved_resource,
03191                                          vreg->base_index + l);
03192                         pred_resource =
03193                           Set_add (pred_resource, vreg->base_index + l);
03194                       }
03195                     /*
03196                      * Assign a spill location if necessary 
03197                      */
03198                     if (vreg->spill_loc == -1)
03199                       vreg->spill_loc = R_spill_loc (vreg->type);
03200                     
03201                     /*
03202                      * Determine the physical register assigned
03203                      */
03204                     bank = R_bank + vreg->type + vreg->rclass;
03205                     
03206                     if (!bank->defined)
03207                       L_punt ("Register allocated to non-existant "
03208                               "register bank!");
03209                     
03210                     phys_map = R_map[vreg->type + vreg->rclass];
03211                     vreg->phys_reg =
03212                       phys_map[vreg->base_index - bank->base_index];
03213                     *bank->used_reg =
03214                       Set_add (*bank->used_reg, vreg->phys_reg);
03215 
03216                     /* Insert the fill instructions prior to the
03217                      * current oper */
03218                     spill_instr = 
03219                       (L_Oper *) O_fill_reg (vreg->phys_reg,
03220                                              R_conv_rclass_to_Lclass
03221                                              (vreg->rclass),
03222                                              pred,
03223                                              vreg->spill_loc,
03224                                              NULL,
03225                                              R_SPILL_CODE);
03226                       
03227                     R_insert_spill_code_before (cb, oper, spill_instr);
03228 
03229                     /*
03230                      * Replace the virtual register with a physical register
03231                      */
03232                     pred->value.r = vreg->phys_reg;
03233                     
03234                     /* save virtual predicate of jsr */
03235                     if (L_general_subroutine_call_opcode (oper))
03236                       {
03237                         L_Attr *new_attr = L_new_attr ("vpred", 1);
03238                         L_set_int_attr_field (new_attr, 0, pred->value.r);
03239                         oper->attr = L_concat_attr (oper->attr, new_attr);
03240                       }
03241                   }
03242                 else
03243                   {
03244                     L_punt ("RA: No free register for spilling all vreg!\n");
03245                   }
03246               }
03247           }
03248 
03249           /* src operands */
03250 
03251           for (i = 0; i < L_max_src_operand; i++)
03252             {
03253               L_Operand *src;
03254               if ((src = oper->src[i]) &&
03255                   L_is_reg (src))
03256                 {
03257                   src_vregs = Set_add (src_vregs, src->value.r);
03258 
03259                   vreg = VREG (src->value.r);
03260                   /* Probing of predicates results in move predicate
03261                      to register operation */
03262                   if (Set_in (pred_vregs, vreg->index))
03263                     {
03264                       free_register = vreg->base_index;
03265                     }
03266                   else
03267                     {
03268                       vreg->rclass = R_CALLER;
03269                       free_register =
03270                         R_find_free_register (vreg, reserved_resource, 1);
03271                       if (L_is_ctype_predicate (src))
03272                         pred_vregs = Set_add (pred_vregs, src->value.r);
03273                     }
03274 
03275                   if (free_register != -1)
03276                     {
03277                       vreg->base_index = free_register;
03278                       vreg->size =
03279                         (R_bank + vreg->type + vreg->rclass)->reg_size;
03280 
03281                       /*
03282                        * Place register in the reserved resource set
03283                        */
03284                       for (l = 0; l < vreg->size; l++)
03285                         {
03286                           reserved_resource =
03287                             (Set) Set_add (reserved_resource,
03288                                            vreg->base_index + l);
03289                         }
03290                       /*
03291                        * Assign a spill location if necessary 
03292                        */
03293                       if (vreg->spill_loc == -1)
03294                         vreg->spill_loc = R_spill_loc (vreg->type);
03295 
03296                       /*
03297                        * Determine the physical register assigned
03298                        */
03299                       bank = R_bank + vreg->type + vreg->rclass;
03300 
03301                       if (!bank->defined)
03302                         L_punt ("Register allocated to non-existant "
03303                                 "register bank!");
03304 
03305                       phys_map = R_map[vreg->type + vreg->rclass];
03306                       vreg->phys_reg =
03307                         phys_map[vreg->base_index - bank->base_index];
03308                       *bank->used_reg =
03309                         Set_add (*bank->used_reg, vreg->phys_reg);
03310 
03311                       /*
03312                        * Insert the fill instructions prior to the current oper
03313                        */
03314                       spill_instr = 
03315                         (L_Oper *) O_fill_reg (vreg->phys_reg,
03316                                                R_conv_rclass_to_Lclass
03317                                                (vreg->rclass),
03318                                                src,
03319                                                vreg->spill_loc,
03320                                                oper->pred,
03321                                                R_SPILL_CODE);
03322                       
03323                       R_insert_spill_code_before (cb, oper, spill_instr);
03324 
03325                       /*
03326                        * Replace the virtual register with a physical register
03327                        */
03328                       src->value.r = vreg->phys_reg;
03329                     }
03330                   else
03331                     L_punt("RA: No free register for spilling all vreg!\n");
03332                 }
03333             }
03334 
03335           /* EMN: Extended source support */
03336 
03337           if ((attr = L_find_attr (oper->attr, "src")) &&
03338               oper->opc == Lop_CHECK)
03339             {
03340               for (i = 0; i < attr->max_field; i++)
03341                 {
03342                   L_Operand *src;
03343                   if (!(src = attr->field[i]))
03344                     continue;
03345                   if (L_is_reg (src))
03346                     {
03347                       src_vregs = Set_add (src_vregs, src->value.r);
03348 
03349                       vreg = VREG (src->value.r);
03350                       /* Probing of predicates results in move
03351                          predicate to register operation */
03352                       if (Set_in (pred_vregs, vreg->index))
03353                         {
03354                           free_register = vreg->base_index;
03355                         }
03356                       else
03357                         {
03358                           vreg->rclass = R_CALLER;
03359                           free_register =
03360                             R_find_free_register (vreg, reserved_resource, 1);
03361                           if (L_is_ctype_predicate (src))
03362                             pred_vregs = Set_add (pred_vregs, src->value.r);
03363                         }
03364 
03365                       if (free_register != -1)
03366                         {
03367                           vreg->base_index = free_register;
03368                           vreg->size =
03369                             (R_bank + vreg->type + vreg->rclass)->reg_size;
03370 
03371                           /*
03372                            * Place register in the reserved resource set
03373                            */
03374                           for (l = 0; l < vreg->size; l++)
03375                             {
03376                               reserved_resource =
03377                                 (Set) Set_add (reserved_resource,
03378                                                vreg->base_index + l);
03379                             }
03380                           /*
03381                            * Assign a spill location if necessary 
03382                            */
03383                           if (vreg->spill_loc == -1)
03384                             vreg->spill_loc = R_spill_loc (vreg->type);
03385 
03386                           /*
03387                            * Determine the physical register assigned
03388                            */
03389                           bank = R_bank + vreg->type + vreg->rclass;
03390 
03391                           if (!bank->defined)
03392                             L_punt ("Register allocated to "
03393                                     "non-existant register bank!");
03394 
03395                           phys_map = R_map[vreg->type + vreg->rclass];
03396                           vreg->phys_reg =
03397                             phys_map[vreg->base_index - bank->base_index];
03398                           *bank->used_reg =
03399                             Set_add (*bank->used_reg, vreg->phys_reg);
03400 
03401                           /* Insert the fill instructions prior to the
03402                            * current oper */
03403                           spill_instr = 
03404                             (L_Oper *) O_fill_reg (vreg->phys_reg,
03405                                                    R_conv_rclass_to_Lclass
03406                                                    (vreg->rclass),
03407                                                    src,
03408                                                    vreg->
03409                                                    spill_loc,
03410                                                    oper->pred,
03411                                                    R_SPILL_CODE);
03412                           
03413                           R_insert_spill_code_before (cb, oper, spill_instr);
03414 
03415                           /* Replace the virtual register with a
03416                            * physical register */
03417                           src->value.r = vreg->phys_reg;
03418                         }
03419                       else
03420                         L_punt("Register Allocation: "
03421                                "No free register for spilling all vreg!!!!\n");
03422                     }
03423                 }
03424             }
03425 
03426           /* dest operands */
03427 
03428           for (i = 0; i < L_max_dest_operand; i++)
03429             {
03430               L_Operand *dest;
03431               if ((dest = oper->dest[i]) &&
03432                   L_is_reg (dest))
03433                 {
03434                   vreg = VREG (dest->value.r);
03435 
03436                   if (Set_in (src_vregs, dest->value.r) ||
03437                       Set_in (pred_vregs, dest->value.r))
03438                     {
03439                       free_register = vreg->base_index;
03440                     }
03441                   else
03442                     {
03443                       vreg->rclass = R_CALLER;
03444                       free_register =
03445                         R_find_free_register (vreg, reserved_resource, 1);
03446                     }
03447 
03448                   if (L_is_ctype_predicate (dest))
03449                     {
03450                       pred_vregs = Set_add (pred_vregs, dest->value.r);
03451                     }
03452 
03453                   if (free_register != -1)
03454                     {
03455                       vreg->base_index = free_register;
03456                       vreg->size =
03457                         (R_bank + vreg->type + vreg->rclass)->reg_size;
03458 
03459                       /*
03460                        * Place register in the reserved resource set
03461                        */
03462                       for (l = 0; l < vreg->size; l++)
03463                         {
03464                           reserved_resource =
03465                             Set_add (reserved_resource, vreg->base_index + l);
03466                           if (L_is_ctype_predicate (dest))
03467                             pred_resource =
03468                               Set_add (pred_resource, vreg->base_index + l);
03469                         }
03470                       /*
03471                        * Assign a spill location if necessary 
03472                        */
03473                       if (vreg->spill_loc == -1)
03474                         vreg->spill_loc = R_spill_loc (vreg->type);
03475 
03476                       /*
03477                        * Determine the physical register assigned
03478                        */
03479                       bank = R_bank + vreg->type + vreg->rclass;
03480 
03481                       if (!bank->defined)
03482                         L_punt ("Register allocated to non-existant "
03483                                 "register bank!");
03484 
03485                       phys_map = R_map[vreg->type + vreg->rclass];
03486                       vreg->phys_reg =
03487                         phys_map[vreg->base_index - bank->base_index];
03488                       *bank->used_reg =
03489                         Set_add (*bank->used_reg, vreg->phys_reg);
03490 
03491                       /*
03492                        * Insert the spill instructions after to the current oper
03493                        */
03494                       spill_instr = 
03495                         (L_Oper *) O_spill_reg (vreg->phys_reg,
03496                                                 R_conv_rclass_to_Lclass
03497                                                 (vreg->rclass),
03498                                                 dest,
03499                                                 vreg->spill_loc,
03500                                                 oper->pred,
03501                                                 R_SPILL_CODE);
03502                       
03503                       R_insert_spill_code_after (cb, oper, spill_instr);
03504 
03505                       /* When spilling all, need to fill some
03506                          predicate destination before define */
03507                       if (L_is_update_predicate_ptype_operand (dest))
03508                         {
03509                           spill_instr = 
03510                             (L_Oper *) O_fill_reg (vreg->phys_reg,
03511                                                    R_conv_rclass_to_Lclass
03512                                                    (vreg->rclass),
03513                                                    dest,
03514                                                    vreg->
03515                                                    spill_loc,
03516                                                    oper->pred,
03517                                                    R_SPILL_CODE);
03518                           
03519                           R_insert_spill_code_before (cb, oper, spill_instr);
03520                         }
03521 
03522                       /* Replace the virtual register with the
03523                        * physical register */
03524                       dest->value.r = vreg->phys_reg;
03525                     }
03526                   else
03527                     L_punt ("RA: No free register for spilling all vreg!\n");
03528                 }
03529             }
03530 
03531           Set_dispose (src_vregs);
03532           Set_dispose (reserved_resource);
03533         }
03534 
03535       Set_dispose (pred_resource);
03536       Set_dispose (pred_vregs);
03537     }
03538 }
03539 
03540 static void
03541 R_regalloc_memory_init (L_Func * fn)
03542 {
03543   int i, tmp;
03544 
03545   /* initialize spill stack counter */
03546   pred_spill_stack = 0;
03547   int_spill_stack = 0;
03548   fp_spill_stack = 0;
03549 
03550   R_oper_set = NULL;
03551 
03552   /* initialize original function oper count */
03553   R_n_oper = fn->max_oper_id;
03554 
03555   R_buf =
03556     (int *) malloc (sizeof (int) *
03557                     (R_MAX (fn->max_reg_id, fn->max_oper_id) + 100));
03558   R_buf2 =
03559     (int *) malloc (sizeof (int) *
03560                     (R_MAX (fn->max_reg_id, fn->max_oper_id) + 100));
03561 
03562   R_pbuf =
03563     (void **) malloc (sizeof (void *) *
03564                       (R_MAX (fn->max_reg_id, fn->max_oper_id) + 100));
03565   R_pbuf2 =
03566     (void **) malloc (sizeof (void *) *
03567                       (R_MAX (fn->max_reg_id, fn->max_oper_id) + 100));
03568 
03569   if (R_alloc_virtual_register == NULL)
03570     {
03571       R_alloc_virtual_register =
03572         L_create_alloc_pool ("R_Reg", sizeof (R_Reg), 256);
03573       R_alloc_interference_arc =
03574         L_create_alloc_pool ("R_Arc", sizeof (R_Arc), 512);
03575     }
03576 
03577   /* Determine Hash Table Size/Mask */
03578   tmp = fn->max_reg_id + 100;
03579   for (i = 31; i >= 0; i--)
03580     if (tmp >> i != 0)
03581       break;
03582 
03583   R_vregHashTbl = HashTable_create (1 << (i + 1));
03584   R_regionAllocMap = HashTable_create (1 << (i + 1));
03585   flowHashTbl = HashTable_create (R_n_oper);
03586 }
03587 
03588 static void
03589 R_regalloc_memory_cleanup (void)
03590 {
03591   R_Reg *vreg, *nextReg;
03592 
03593   /*
03594    * Tear down the interference graph and free up virtual register structures
03595    */
03596   for (vreg = R_vreg; vreg != NULL; vreg = nextReg)
03597     {
03598       R_Arc *arc, *tmp;
03599       nextReg = vreg->nextReg;
03600 
03601       /*
03602          * In disposing of these two sets care must be taken,
03603          * since the <live_range> set may be set to the <ref_instr>
03604          * set during the allocation process.
03605          * It would be bad to dispose of the same set twice
03606        */
03607       if (vreg->ref_instr != vreg->live_range)
03608         Set_dispose (vreg->ref_instr);
03609 
03610       Set_dispose (vreg->live_range);
03611       Set_dispose (vreg->def_instr);
03612       Set_dispose (vreg->ref_cbs);
03613       Set_dispose (vreg->intf_vreg);
03614       
03615       /* Free the interference arcs for this node */
03616       for (arc = vreg->interfere; arc != NULL; arc = tmp)
03617         {
03618           tmp = arc->next;
03619           L_free (R_alloc_interference_arc, arc);
03620         }
03621 
03622       /* free virtual register structure */
03623       L_free (R_alloc_virtual_register, vreg);
03624     }
03625 
03626   L_free_alloc_pool (R_alloc_interference_arc);
03627   R_alloc_interference_arc = NULL;
03628   L_free_alloc_pool (R_alloc_virtual_register);
03629   R_alloc_virtual_register = NULL;
03630 
03631   R_vreg = NULL;
03632 
03633   HashTable_free (R_vregHashTbl);
03634   HashTable_free (R_regionAllocMap);
03635   HashTable_free (flowHashTbl);
03636 
03637   free (R_buf);
03638   free (R_buf2);
03639 
03640   free (R_pbuf);
03641   free (R_pbuf2);
03642 
03643   if (R_Macro_Allocation)
03644     {
03645       if (R_avail_macro)
03646         free (R_avail_macro);
03647       if (R_jsr_def_macro)
03648         free (R_jsr_def_macro);
03649     }
03650   R_jsr_list = List_reset (R_jsr_list);
03651   R_oper_set = Set_dispose (R_oper_set);
03652 }
03653 
03654 /*===========================================================================
03655  *
03656  *      Func :  R_register_allocation()
03657  *      Desc :  The register allocation driver routine.
03658  *      Input:  L_Func *fn - function to allocate
03659  *      Output: The function allocated to the target processor, the registers
03660  *              used are returned via pointers provided with the register
03661  *              bank definitions and the size of the required swap space.
03662  *
03663  *===========================================================================*/
03664 
03665 int
03666 R_register_allocation (L_Func * fn, Parm_Macro_List * command_line_macro_list)
03667 {
03668   int ispace, fspace, pspace;
03669 
03670   R_register_allocation_sep (fn, command_line_macro_list, 
03671                              &ispace, &fspace, &pspace);
03672   return (ispace + fspace + pspace);
03673 }
03674 
03675 int
03676 R_register_allocation_sep (L_Func * fn,
03677                            Parm_Macro_List * command_line_macro_list,
03678                            int *int_swap_space_size, int *fp_swap_space_size,
03679                            int *pred_swap_space_size)
03680 {
03681   int pred_jsr_swap_space = 0;
03682   int int_jsr_swap_space = 0;
03683   int fp_jsr_swap_space = 0;
03684   L_Cb *cur_cb;
03685 
03686   L_Region *region;
03687   L_Region_Member *member;
03688   L_Time regalloc_time;
03689   L_Attr *attr;
03690   void *start, *end;
03691 
03692   double total, spill;
03693   double total_callee_weight = 0.0;
03694 
03695   total_instruction_weight = 0.0;
03696   total_spill_weight = 0.0;
03697   total_region_spill_weight = 0.0;
03698   total_caller_weight = 0.0;
03699 
03700   L_init_time (&regalloc_time);
03701   L_start_time (&regalloc_time);
03702 
03703 #ifndef __WIN32__
03704   start = sbrk (0);
03705 #else
03706 /* ADA 5/29/96: There is no easy way to emulate sbrk() on Win95/NT */
03707   start = 0;
03708 #endif
03709 
03710   if (R_Init)
03711     {
03712       R_regalloc_version ();
03713       /* Renamed 'Regalloc' to 'Lregalloc' -JCG 5/26/98 */
03714       L_load_parameters_aliased (L_parm_file, command_line_macro_list,
03715                                  "(Lregalloc", "(Regalloc",
03716                                  R_read_parm_regalloc);
03717       R_Init = 0;
03718     }
03719 
03720   if (R_Print_Parm_Configuration)
03721     R_print_parm_configuration ();
03722 
03723   R_analyze_bank_overlap ();
03724 
03725   if (R_Print_Bank_Configuration)
03726     R_print_bank_configuration ();
03727 
03728   if (!R_Spill_Everything)
03729     {
03730       if (!R_Region_Based_Allocation)
03731         {
03732           Set R_rot_reg = R_build_rotating_reg_set (fn);
03733           L_rename_disjoint_virtual_registers (fn, R_rot_reg);
03734           Set_dispose (R_rot_reg);
03735         }
03736 
03737       L_setup_dataflow_no_operands (fn);
03738 
03739       if (!R_Utilize_Profile_Info)
03740         {
03741           /* If we are not to use profile information, then compute
03742            * oper weights statically by using loop nesting level
03743            * information.  */
03744           L_dataflow_analysis (DOMINATOR_CB);
03745           L_loop_detection (fn, 0);
03746           L_compute_static_cb_weight (fn);
03747         }
03748 
03749       L_compute_oper_weight (fn, !R_Utilize_Profile_Info,
03750                              R_Utilize_Profile_Info);
03751     }
03752 
03753   R_regalloc_memory_init (fn);
03754 
03755   /*
03756    *  Determine available macro registers 
03757    */
03758   if (M_arch == M_HPPA)
03759     R_init_pa_set ();
03760   
03761   R_determine_available_macros ();
03762   
03763   R_Region = region = R_assemble_region (fn);
03764   R_unmap_physical_registers (region);
03765 
03766   /* initialize spill stack counter */
03767   
03768   R_init_spill_stack (region, &fp_spill_stack, &int_spill_stack, 
03769                       &pred_spill_stack);
03770 
03771   if (!R_Spill_Everything)
03772     {
03773       /* 
03774        *  0. set up oper, live range structures
03775        */
03776       for (cur_cb = fn->first_cb; cur_cb != NULL; cur_cb = cur_cb->next_cb)
03777         {
03778           if (L_EXTRACT_BIT_VAL (cur_cb->flags, L_CB_ENTRANCE_BOUNDARY) &&
03779               L_EXTRACT_BIT_VAL (cur_cb->flags, L_CB_PROLOGUE))
03780             continue;
03781           R_process_cb (cur_cb);
03782         }
03783 
03784       /* 
03785        *  1. compute the dataflow information
03786        */
03787       R_compute_dataflow_info (fn);
03788 
03789       /*
03790        *  2. determine flyby live ranges within the region
03791        */
03792       R_determine_region_flybys (region);
03793 
03794       R_sort_vreg_list ();
03795 
03796       /*
03797        *  3. determine allocation constraints
03798        */
03799       R_determine_allocation_constraints (region);
03800 
03801       /* 
03802        *     debugging step for looking at function's live
03803        *     ranges,interference graph 
03804        */
03805       if (R_Print_Virtual_Register_Function)
03806         DB_spit_func (fn, "Virtual_func");
03807 
03808       /*
03809        *  4. compute virtual register live ranges 
03810        */
03811       R_compute_live_ranges (fn, region);
03812 
03813       /*  
03814        *  5. generate caller/callee saved weights and bank preferences
03815        *     for each virtual register 
03816        */
03817       R_register_saving_convention_selection (fn, region);
03818 
03819       /*
03820        *  6. construct virtual register interference graph
03821        */
03822       R_construct_interference_graph (fn, region);
03823 
03824       /*
03825        *  7. perform register allocation
03826        *     sort all nodes in the interference graph and
03827        *     allocate from the most important to the least
03828        *     important
03829        */
03830       R_allocate_virtual_registers (fn);
03831       L_save_virtual_pred_reg_numbers_in_attr (fn);
03832 
03833       /*
03834        *  8. convert virtual register numbers to machine register numbers
03835        */
03836       R_virtual_to_machine_conversion ();
03837 
03838       /*
03839        *  9. insert necessary spill code
03840        */
03841       R_insert_spill_fill_code (region);
03842 
03843       /*
03844        * 10. insert code to save caller-saved registers  
03845        */
03846       R_insert_jsr_spill_fill_code (fn, &int_jsr_swap_space,
03847                                     &fp_jsr_swap_space,
03848                                     &pred_jsr_swap_space);
03849       pred_spill_stack += pred_jsr_swap_space;
03850       int_spill_stack += int_jsr_swap_space;
03851       fp_spill_stack += fp_jsr_swap_space;
03852 
03853       /*
03854        * 11. reconcile the allocated region 
03855        */
03856       R_update_alloc_state (region);
03857       R_update_region_spill_stack (region);
03858       R_reconcile_allocated_region (region);
03859       R_insert_reconciliation_code (fn, region);
03860     }
03861   else
03862     {
03863       for (member = region->member_cbs;
03864            member != NULL; member = member->next_member)
03865         R_process_cb_for_spilling (fn, member->cb);
03866 
03867       L_save_virtual_pred_reg_numbers_in_attr (fn);
03868       R_spill_all_virtual_registers (fn, region);
03869     }
03870 
03871   if (R_Print_Allocation_Stats)
03872     {
03873       Set callee_int, callee_dbl;
03874 
03875       callee_int = ((R_bank[R_CALLER + R_INT].used_reg != NULL) ?
03876                     *(R_bank[R_CALLER + R_INT].used_reg) : NULL);
03877       callee_dbl = ((R_bank[R_CALLER + R_DOUBLE].used_reg != NULL) ?
03878                     *(R_bank[R_CALLER + R_DOUBLE].used_reg) : NULL);
03879       total_callee_weight = (fn->weight * 2.0 *
03880                              Set_size (callee_int) + Set_size (callee_dbl));
03881 
03882       total = total_instruction_weight + total_spill_weight +
03883         total_caller_weight + total_callee_weight + total_region_spill_weight;
03884       spill = total - total_instruction_weight;
03885 
03886       fprintf (stdout, "%f\t%f\t%f\t%f\t%f\n", total,
03887                total_spill_weight,
03888                total_caller_weight,
03889                total_callee_weight, total_region_spill_weight);
03890     }
03891 
03892   R_regalloc_memory_cleanup ();
03893 
03894   fn->flags = L_SET_BIT_FLAG (fn->flags, L_FUNC_REGISTER_ALLOCATED);
03895 
03896   L_stop_time (&regalloc_time);
03897 
03898 #ifndef __WIN32__
03899   end = sbrk (0);
03900 #else
03901 /* ADA 5/29/96: There is no easy way to emulate sbrk() on Win95/NT */
03902   end = 0;
03903 #endif
03904 
03905   attr = L_new_attr ("reg_time", 1);
03906   L_set_double_attr_field (attr, 0, L_final_time (&regalloc_time));
03907   fn->attr = L_concat_attr (fn->attr, attr);
03908 
03909   attr = L_new_attr ("reg_mem_usage", 1);
03910   L_set_int_attr_field (attr, 0, (long int) end - (long int) start);
03911   fn->attr = L_concat_attr (fn->attr, attr);
03912 
03913   *pred_swap_space_size = pred_spill_stack;
03914   *int_swap_space_size = int_spill_stack;
03915   *fp_swap_space_size = fp_spill_stack;
03916 
03917   {
03918     L_Cb *cb;
03919     L_Oper *op;
03920     int i;
03921 
03922     for (cb = fn->first_cb; cb; cb = cb->next_cb)
03923       for (op = cb->first_op; op; op = op->next_op)
03924         for (i = 0; i < L_max_dest_operand; i++)
03925           {
03926             if (op->dest[i] && L_is_reg (op->dest[i])
03927                 && op->dest[i]->value.r > fn->max_reg_id)
03928               fn->max_reg_id = op->dest[i]->value.r;
03929           }
03930   }
03931 
03932   return (pred_spill_stack + int_spill_stack + fp_spill_stack);
03933 }
